description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased several or these in gray and black. I am 6’180lbs  athletic build and purchased a large. I like the fitted style. Very comfortable shirt. I would recommend it.
review.name: Great shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have several of these shirts. They fit and feel great. Love the lightness of the textile. I am using this shirt every day running  and have had no issues with tearing etc. The textile is very thin, so you may need to be a bit more careful when taking the shirt off while wet and sticky.
review.name: Great shirt for running and exercise.

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: These things start ripping apart after the first use. Do not buy.
review.name: Absolute junk

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Awesome shirt, my new favorite for Sunny Florida. Looks good  super light weight and breathable
review.name: Super lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shirt.  The fit is snug, but the fabric is stretchy.  Works well as a light baselayer or a warm weather run shirt.  The smooth surface allows you to wear it under a napped, fleece, or waffle knit fabric without bunching up.  As a warm weather shirt it it doesn't accumulate much sweat and is cool.
review.name: Patagonia lightweight shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shirt ripped the very first time I put it on. Then I washed it and the threads started coming out. Don't get me wrong, the fit and performance are great. But it's so thin that it seems like it's not built to last.
review.name: Great shirt, so so quality

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wearing this shirt is almost like wearing air. It works well as a warm weather shirt to handle sweat but doesn?t really work as a warming base layer. I live and backpack in a hot humid climate so it works for me. I am between sizes so I bought the large and I?m very happy with it. I?ll be interested to see how durable this shirt is. So far, it?s one of my favorite pieces of clothing. It?s a bit pricy for a simple t-shirt but you only need one. It?s easy to wash and dry but with the anti-bacterial treatment it never smells so you won?t need to do much more than rinse it every once in a while.
review.name: Light warm weather shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shirt executes extremely well, the breathability is phenomenal and the quick moisture wicking from that makes it a really great shirt on hot days. The tech of it made me move swiftly, with no chafing. I am comparable to that of a tree trunk when it comes to body shape. I wear a medium, but more often than not my shoulders are that of a large but chest down I am that of a medium. This shirt did well on executing for a different body shape for the size it is. It was slightly tight on my back, but that?s more of a me thing than it is a shirt thing.
review.name: Moisture Wicking, Thin, Durable.

name: Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
Capilene Cool Lightweight Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice bib, however the straps are to tight over the shoulders.
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Stable sizing, bought same over the course of last 5 years,  always good fit.
review.name: Reliable bibs

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the fit of these bibs. Chamois is very comfortable and provides just the right amount of cushioning. Leg grippers work great. The color combination looks great.
review.name: Great pair of bibs

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Buying bibs that fit well is tough. I am 155lbs & 5'11", skinny runner build. Med is too short, but Lrg is too loose at the leg grippers. It is a great bib otherwise.
review.name: Poor fit

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good quality bib with secure padding in the right places, but I’m pretty average height at 5’8” and the size L barely fits me. It has more than enough room around the middle, but the length of the suspender part is much too short. Be sure and order at least one size up, or two if you have a longer torso.
review.name: Fits very small in height

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Just received the bib shorts and tried them on. Ouch. Either I got taller and added some weight in the past week or these bibs are small. Figured out the bibs run small. The straps were pulling down on my shoulders (trapezius muscle) as well. Not a comfortable feeling.

I'm 5'10", 150 lbs. with 30/31" waist. Do not order mediums! Get a pair of Large instead.
review.name: Runs Small

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These bibs are are great - I have them in a couple of different colors for kit options. They may fall in line near the entry level side of the Castelli bib offerings, but they are reliable and just like other Castelli products, they are well constructed, and are super comfortable.
review.name: Competizione bibs  are a great product!

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: it was a great BIB used for cape town tour 2024.  Comfort, aligned in performance. it was a great ride and work-out material. it also suit my jersey combination
review.name: my CPT BIB

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought my normal size large (I am 5'10", 150lb).  They are very nice shorts.  However.... be aware that the inseam length is much shorter than other Castelli bibs I have used.  I am returning them because they are so short.  The Free Aero RC is much longer and I would recommend that bib 100%.
review.name: Inseam is too small

review.itemreviewed: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
So as to help out others: I am 5'11" 190 lbs with average build (you get what you get genetics-wise!) with slightly bigger thighs than the average build. The XXL (yes, a double-X-L) fits me well. An XL would have been too tight to reasonably wear.

The fit is tight enough but not too tight.
Leg and strap length fits me well.
I intend to use this indoors so the thin material is appropriate and what I prefer.
Pad more than sufficient for 30-45 minutes of cycling.
review.name: Fits me well. I recommend it.

name: Competizione Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Canada Goose Alliston Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alliston Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Canada Goose Alliston Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is exactly what I was looking for to replace an old North Face full length down coat that expired after 14 years and whose quality has not been duplicated in recent editions. Unlike other Canada Goose coats I have tried on that are literally unwearable because of their weight, this one does not weigh a ton yet is super warm for those of us who are always cold.  It has snaps! for those times you don't want to zip it up fully.  Down lining extends all the way through the length of this coat. It has wrist cuffs to block cold. It runs large in the hips but who cares?! shoulders are perfect. The hood is also lined with down and fits perfectly. The logo is the only negative thing about this coat, and as it is sewn on it is easy to remove. If you are always cold, you need this coat!
review.name: Perfect winter coat.

name: Alliston Parka - Women's

Backcountry-asking for help here please!

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great light weight but warm jacket. My daughter loves it. The quality it great and she doesn't feel to bulky.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and light weight, my little one is 7yR old 60 lbs but on the thin side. This medium fits like a large. But then again all columbia jackets we own for kids run large. I should have sized down but I thought this was a true to size jacket.
review.name: Light weight and warm

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket is top notch and the mother of the gift says it is darling!!  She can’t wait for Christmas for her daughter to own the gift so she can wear it!!  I’m so pleased with the purchase!!
review.name: Excellent purchase!!

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket is nice and warm fits perfectly I love the colors is good for the winter. Sometimes you get overheated in the jacket but that’s a good thing. You’ll never be cold. I love columbia.com products.
review.name: Every year I like to buy jackets from Columbia

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Coat fit well and is a great weight for late fall, or early spring. We use as a layer for winter sport. 
Only complaint is that the seam by the pocket came undone, requiring us to mend. We almost sent it back as a defective item, only worn for about 2 weeks of light use when the seam came undone, creating a hand sized hole in the side of the jacket.
review.name: Good, seams come undone

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great coat, fit is perfect. Seems to keep kids warm in Montana winters
review.name: Warm for winter

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great puffer, we have ordered probably 5 or 6 of these over the years for our kids as they grow.  Great for cool days or layering.
review.name: Best kids puffer jacket and layer

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like how soft and lightweight this coat is. My daughter finds it comfy, too. It is true to size. She had a North Face coat last year and this one seems warmer, so far.
review.name: Nice Coat

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought a size L for my 11 year old daughter and it fit perfect!
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Girls'

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I use this for cross country skiing. Stylish lightweight but warm. 
Many compliments on the colours!
review.name: I use this for cross

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have a couple of these and love the versatility for layering options. A base-layer by itself or mid-weight layer over lighter base layer options make it my go to for many seasonal pursuits. Breathable and super comfy. The hood is the perfect liner under a ski helmet on cold outings when the Coefficient is worn under a shell or puffy. By itself, it's a great active layer with the hood for shade or a little warmth on a chilly morning while making coffee at the campsite. Highly recommend! Get two so you have a clean one on standby!
review.name: Versatile mid-layer

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This may be it. The perfect layer for high-output activities. Lots of pieces claim to be made for aerobic pursuits, but they are very sweaty. Somehow, this piece isn’t. Lightweight, comfortable, & just the right amount of warmth.
review.name: Perfect Aerobic Hoody

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought the Coefficient LT as a mid layer for alpine SAR work. I have not used it for this purpose yet but have found myself using it every morning on my mountain bike rides and it’s amazing! It keeps me warm and is really breathable at the same time. I’ve never had a garment to both things so well at the same time! My only gripe is that the material snags pretty easily so you need to be careful, I already put a small hole in mine.
review.name: Love this mid layer!

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Every time I pick this thing up I'm shocked at how light it is. Awesome piece of kit for the colder months, has been good so far this fall at 8,000 feet in Colorado. Really good as a next-to-skin base layer, or a medium layer. Fit is a little strange though: I am a M about 75-85% of the time, but this M was very tight in the mid-section (arms and waist length were perfect). Ordered the L and its much better, but the armpit area is a little loose. Might need to adjust the cut in future years. (5. 9, 160ibs). Overall, I recommend this top.
review.name: Its like magic

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The men's coefficient hoodie is a perfect addition to any ski or touring ensemble. The grid design makes it the perfect insulating layer, but its thin breathable design makes it perfect for a day of skinning. Simultaneously the front torso works as a windbreaker keeping your core toasty, while the breathable back prevents overheating when carrying a pack. The fit is loose enough to allow a base layer beneath, but tight enough to work as it's own base layer, and the hood is well designed to fit comfortably beneath a helmet. When you get to the top, just throw over a shell and your are ready to go. This hoodie is a must have for any A/T skier.
review.name: Thoughtful design in a versatile midlayer

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been using this hoody on climbs, b/c ski trip, etc. It works well for my body type (slim and tall). It packs great and weighs nothing. One thing that I wish it had is re-enforced shoulders: I worry about wearing a pack directly on top of the hoody.
review.name: Love this lightweight hoody

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a not a good jacket, period. The small fits weirdly around the armpits and is loose overall. I prefer the fit of the Patagonia R1 Air Small and Mammut Aenergy ML Small over this any day. While this jacket is intended to be a middle ground between the above two jackets, it falls short both in terms of warmth and moisture management. I would highly recommend getting the above two jackets instead of this one. Your bank account will complain in the short term but you will benefit from the versatility of the aforementioned jackets instead of this one mediocre and overpriced jacket. Returning it. I am 31, 5’9”, 150lbs and in a good athletic shape.
review.name: Terrible fit and not worth the price

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Pros: semi-light.

Cons:
- fabric is little itchy.
Not a soft as prior Coefficient vest I own
- zipper is a bit difficult to operate
- has a chemical smell
- mesh leaves head cold

Returned it
review.name: Cons outweigh pros

review.itemreviewed: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: My favorite piece of wearable gear. I run cold so perfect for me.
review.name: My favorite piece of wearable

name: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Retro-X Coat - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I'm 165 cm tall and weigh 142 lbs. I initially bought size M, but it felt too tight around my chest. Later, I tried size L, but it was so large that I couldn't even reach the pockets—they were located below my thighs! Compared to another jacket from the same brand, the L size of this one is significantly larger.

I recommend buying two sizes to try and choosing the one that fits best. Unfortunately, since I purchased from overseas, I didn’t have this option, which was really disappointing.

Thanks!
review.name: Sizing is Difficult to Manage for This J

review.reviewBody: I don’t hate the coat but I hate that I was taken advantage of. Purchased the coat during a buy an item at full price and get 20% off. I didn’t get the 20% off and during a chat  with the company they advised they would give me 20% off next item because I had already received the item. The jokes on me because this was a splurge for myself and don’t usually spend this much on any one item.
review.name: Love the coat but….
comment: We are very sorry the promo did not apply on this on the site due to brand exclusions.  We have emailed you to see if we can help resolve the situation.

review.reviewBody: Runs small especially if you want to wear anything heavier underneath so size up one size--normally an XL the XXL gave that little extra-needed room.  Love the color. Fit is nice even if a curvy girl.  Great price!
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody:
No wonder they call this a coat not a jacket.  It's warmer than I thought.  
I regret I didn't believe the detail "Item runs large, so we recommend sizing down for best fit." 
If you read this, PLEASE SIZE DOWN.  Even it's too big for me, I still love this coat.  I'm able to fit a Patagonia light down jacket underneath.  
I got a XS for my 10 year old girl, it's too big for her too, but she loves it.  XS is a tight fit for me. 
So, size S would be perfect.  
The only down side is unlike the other Retro X jackets, this coat's 2 side pockets don't have zippers.  So, be careful when you put things in side pockets.  The chest pocket is big and very useful.  Thank you Patagonia and Backcountry.
review.name: love love love but runs big

review.reviewBody: I bought the red jacket and love it.  So nice and roomy and warm.  I can be outside in 5 degrees and it’s still nice and warm.  It’s roomy enough to out a sweatshirt or sweater under it.  I want another color.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I really love this jacket and the red color. It's cozy and very warm.  My only caveat is how big it runs.  I'm normally a medium in Patagonia and other brads, but it was gigantic. Even the small is a bit oversized but I kept it because of the color and coziness!  As a reference I'm about 5/8 and 145lb, so anyone who is typically a small would absolutely find this too big.
review.name: Cozy & warm

review.reviewBody: I couldn't spend a lot of money on a jacket but I am new to living in the mountains and was definitely not prepared for how cold it can get. This jacket keeps me warm and the three pockets are such a plus! It is so warm and comfy without being too bulgy and it can keep me warm as the temps drop to 30 degrees F or below. I got a medium even though I am probably a small so that I can layer up underneath when needed.
review.name: Just what I needed!

review.reviewBody: The shoulders in this coat are cut very full but bottom is slender.  I ordered my usual medium size but the bottom was so snug it felt confining when zipped up.  It wouldn't work to order larger because the upper part of the coat would have been huge.  The fabric was beautiful and the inside felt very silky.  I'm disappointed in the cut so I had to return it.
review.name: Cut Wasn't For Me

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket! It’s the perfect amount of roomy and the shroom taupe color is way better in person. I was worried the natural would get dirty too easily. The inside lining is soft and feels great with just a tee. It’s warm enough without layers for running errands but fits a sweatshirt comfortably without looking too bulky. I have washed it once and it came out great, maybe even a little softer. No shrinkage. The only thing I would change/add would be zippered pockets. The pockets are lined with a soft fleecy like material but they are just open and my phone has fallen out a couple of times.
review.name: My go to jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought in nest brown color and I absolutely love this coat.  It fits oversized, so it feels like I'm wearing my boyfriend's coat, but it still looks super cute. The inside isn't lined with the same fleece, but it's still very soft, comfortable, and warm. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Perfect Fall Jacket

name: Retro-X Coat - Women's

review.name: Warm!

review.reviewBody: These guys will leave your lil fingers chilly! Wore them during a 30 degree evening and I was kinda sad! Need to find a new pair for colder days!
review.name: Kinda sad :(

review.reviewBody: I bought these in size small.  This glove is exactly what I was looking for--a fairly lightweight wind resistant glove for hiking in Patagonia in January-February.  While the palm fits well (there is considerable stretch in the fabric), the fingers are at least 1/2" too long.  There is no XS option.  I don't know for whom these are designed, but not me.  Based on the OR sizing chart palm circumference, I should have been a medium, which I knew was wrong.  I'm going to have to return the glove.  Still looking ....
review.name: Fingers Are Too Long

hasVariant.description: Buy the Ergon SM Sport Gel Saddle - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the first saddle I have ever owned that I don't think about when I'm riding. It is just comfortable. Measure your sit bones, select your size, and enjoy.
review.name: The saddle I don't think about

review.reviewBody: At first she was hesitant when I removed her stock seat, said it felt about the same.  After quite a bit of MTB use, it seems to have a break in period.  She wasn't quite convinced but now noticed she's not chafing or rubbing anymore and getting better with time. Seems to do what it is supposed to, no sore seat bones either.
review.name: Saddle Talk

review.reviewBody:
This saddle has 5 star reviews everywhere so I was pretty excited to try it. My previous saddles cause extreme discomfort/pain and numbing which results in me having to stop and get off my bike every 15 minutes or so. This saddle brings a whole new pain into the mix: pinching! I was constantly shifting and trying to find that sweet spot on the saddle but it just never happened. It also caused a lot of chafing even with chamois cream.  

The saddle seems to be well-made and the sit-bone area was comfortable, it's just not the right saddle for me.
review.name: Not the right saddle for me
comment: the chafing i noticed immediately though i was wearing jean shorts for the test run.   i right away wondered why bike manufacturers choose fabric for saddle covers that cause friction given there is quite a bit of sliding about, especially when on trails.      got the men's on my CX bike since it came free with a preowned frame i'm building.   the broken pelvis (7 months ago) pain was almost non existent though and i forgot all about the saddle by mile 3.   .   that is what i LOVED and has me online search for  a shorter womens version.   but i can't do cut outs.  i think that would exacerbate pain if you hit it wrong.

name: SM Sport Gel Saddle - Women's

review.reviewBody: I like that these valve caps are more permanent than the ones that come with the tubes. I got these because they are another distinctive accent for my bike.

review.reviewBody: Really got these for a superficial want of a shiny color. But after receiving, I found that they screw into the valve in a muuuuch more satisfyingly secure way than a plastic cap. I'm replacing all my plastic caps now with metal ones so I no longer have to worry about screwing caps too tight and stripping plastic threads.
review.name: Surprisingly worth the $

review.reviewBody: I had a habit of breaking the plastic caps, so I got these to replace them. I've since put them on all my bikes in different colors.
review.name: Slick

review.reviewBody: exceptional quality for the price.. I thought the overalls would be a button type and not a velcro type (the velcro is infinitely adjustable) but lose their adhesiveness in the long run... so there's that. as for the actual pants... they're great.. no complaints. for 5,10 and above.. even a large might feel a wee bit small if your running pads underneath. overall great pants..
review.name: troy lee dungarees

review.reviewBody: One of the straps came apart at the seems after the first use and the other one needed reinforcement. I chose to repair them myself as Backcountry return policy is subpar.
review.name: poor quality

review.reviewBody: I would like the side buttons to be more resistant because they open, and for the belt to be better with a hook or button, but the material and details of this jumpsuit are incredible!! I would like you to do an update on these overalls!!!
review.name: Great quality but...

review.reviewBody: The most versatile piece of clothing I've ever owned. These breathe incredibly well and I feel so agile in them. Whether I'm ripping the trails, or playing beer die at the post ride hang, I never feel held back. There's pockets for everything I need on or off the bike, tons of adjustability, and not to mention they're stylish. Seriously, I'd never received so many compliments on a pair of pants/overalls in my life. These are now part of my go to ride/post ride kit and I will definitely be buying more! Troy Lee Designs knocked it out of the park with these.
review.name: The Greatest Overall Ever?

name: Oversender Overall - Men's

review.reviewBody: These shorts are incredibly comfortable with added stretch, making them perfect for both hiking and casual wear
review.name: I would buy again this product again

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts!!! The material feel and stretch are really comfortable and love that they are offered in multiple lengths! I actually like them so much I now own them in every color option. Additionally the the DWR water resistance is a great bonus and really saved me when a dog accidentally peed on my lap during a family party and it just dripped right off. Great product!!
review.name: Greatest Shorts I Own

review.reviewBody: These seemed to run a bit big. I will be sizing down.
review.name: Good material, a bit big.

review.reviewBody: Please bring back the front zipper pocket from the original Wander shorts. Wanted to buy the new ones but the back zipper pocket is a dealbreaker. No one puts their wallet in the back pocket anymore!!
review.name: The 2.0 ruined the absolutely perfect Wander 1.0 Short

review.reviewBody: Love the material and I wish I would have had these in my life sooner.
review.name: New fav. workout short

review.reviewBody: Wish I would have discovered these years ago. Love the material.
review.name: Take me back in time

review.reviewBody: Love these for everything! Great for everyday but love for tennis and hiking.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: I wear them to work. They are very comfortable. I love the back pocket cause my wallet doesn't bother me when I am driving.
review.name: Awesome pair of shorts!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, looks great. I really like the back zippered pocket. Front pockets are nice and deep, phone fits and stays as does car key. Played tennis with them and everything stayed put. Should of bought the other color while they were on sale. Next time!!! HA!
review.name: Comfortable and Look Great!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, lightweight they are perfect for the summer months. Can easily be used as casual shorts and if the mood takes a quick jump in the pool or lake. I have several pairs and use them all regularly.
review.name: Definitely recommend

review.reviewBody: WARNING - THE TALC COLOR SHOWS THE DOWN BENEATH THE MATERIAL. See photos. Love the material of this jacket. Bought it in a different color and a different style and will be keeping it, but not this one. I really believe a lot of companies struggle to have a light material over down. You a lot of times see the down beneath it.
review.name: TALC COLOR BEWARE

review.reviewBody: Super warm, lightweight, easy to move in. I'm 5'1", 130lbs, 34D and the small fits perfectly with or without a thick hoodie underneath. Highly recommend!
review.name: Petite Friendly

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this coat less than a year and the reviews about the down leaving the shoulders is correct and so strange. Not wearable in actual cold weather now. Would definitely not recommend.
review.name: Not recommend

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a disappointment. I bought a similar higher-end Mountain Hardwear coat with a slightly lower fill power. I think it was 650. I love stretchdown and wanted the latest very warm stretchdown coat. I chose the toastiest one. But this coat arrived today and it is not toasty. The squares seem to have much less loft. It seems thin. I am so disappointed. I will say that, at times, I have felt like women's styles seem to have less loft than the similar men's styles. That does not make sense but Mountain Hardwear has always been more of a men's brand.
review.name: Not the puffy stretchdown coat I had hoped for

review.reviewBody: I have been eyeing this jacket for a very long time. I finally decided to to make the purchase with the Outer Limits Blue. I am so glad I did !!!! The jacket is perfect ! Mid thigh length, double zipper, chest pocket, and light stretch. What more could you ask for in a jacket?!
review.name: Obsessed!

review.reviewBody: My favorite winter coat! It keeps me super warm. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best coat

review.reviewBody: Omg I love this coat so much — I’ve only recently received it but the fit, feel, color, and warmth are just perfect. I’ve had other stretch down jackets from Mountain Hardwear but this is the first one that I’ve been truly thrilled with. I got the “outer dark” color, which is like a vibrant navy blue. The hood is terrific. The pockets are capacious. The proportions are just right. The stretch down fabric is so comfortable and ideal for movement. I’m traveling this winter between cold and warm-ish zones and this will be the perfect coat to travel with, that is highly warm but also packable. This is the coat I’ve been striving to find!
review.name: Finally found my elusive perfect down parka

review.reviewBody:
Great Parka. I love the stretch. I wear it on cold days (40degrees+) with just a base layer. On really cold days I layer a sweater underneath. 
 I am 123lbs, 5ft 5", and bought a Medium, I usually wear a small.
There was some down migration at the shoulder but I washed, dried and patted the downfill back in place. For a puffy jacket its flattering.
review.name: Stretchy!

review.reviewBody: I bought the stretch down hoody and loved it so much I decided to to try the parka. I live in Alaska and you need a lot of jacket options if you get outside much. This one makes me want to get rid of all the others. It’s the most comfortable down parka I have ever worn. The sizing is generous and easily accommodated a sweater or multiple layers while still giving you the air pocket needed for warmth. You could size down but at 5 feet tall and 120lbs I find it the perfect roomy jacket that goes over everything. The hood cinches down tight for added protection in wind and the stretch makes this feel like you are not wearing anything at all. It really moves with you to stop that tightly bundled feeling but still giving all the warmth.
review.name: You will want to live in this

review.reviewBody:
I'm a yoga hiking guide and CA Naturalist in Northern California. I'm usually a size medium, and I ordered a medium in the stunning and subtle purple color. This piece fits comfortably with room to spare for base layers. The flexibility and comfort of the Stretchdown material is remarkable. Everything about this coat, from the zippered pockets to secure my items while I play outside, to the slightly elasticized wrists and bottom hem, neck coverage, enclosed hoodie, and length to help stay warm, has me singing its praises. 
I love to practice yoga outside, and I've stayed super warm during my cold early morning sessions, enjoying full range of motion in this parka. It's also been a great casual parka for everyday use, as I like to stay warm and snuggly even when its not super cold outside. My only suggestion would be to include an elastic cinch on the hood and bottom of the coat to help enclose body heat in colder temps and wind.
review.name: I absolutely love this parka!

name: Stretchdown Parka - Women's

description: Buy the Katadyn Gravity BeFree 6L Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gravity BeFree 6L Microfilter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Katadyn Gravity BeFree 6L Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I used this for a week long camping trip with 3 people. We were able to fill the bag each day and hang it from a tree at the campsite. The water tasted amazing, with no plastic taste from the bag. It filtered extremely fast with good flow, allowing me to fill a 2 liter bag in around a minute. Care and cleaning are extremely easy. The bag is durable and does not seem easy to rip. I can't say enough good, one of my favorite purchases for our recent camping trip. Buy with confidence.
review.name: Worked Great

review.reviewBody: Used for two people on a ten day trip. Definitely filtered less than 4L per day.  Worked great when it worked. Took it backpacking a couple months later and it wouldn't pass a single drop of water.  Have read many other bad reports since then.  Clean water in the backcountry is not something to gamble on.  Absolutely would not recommend this product.  There are other filters out there that won't fail you.
review.name: Unreliable. 100% clogged after less than 40L.

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, great filter speed, works great for group backpacking trips

I took this filter on a recent hike in the backcountry.  The Gravity BeFree was clutch once I got to camp and needed to filter larger quantities of water for cooking and drinking (the area we were in is quite remote so you need to be prepared).  The filter is easy to use, and packs into a relatively small bag for the amount of water it is capable of filtering.
review.name: Easy To Use Filter

review.reviewBody: Packable, lightweight. I've hung it from a tree branch, I've hung it from trekking poles. Easily assembled.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: I’ve always had pump filters in the past.  The gravity setup is better in every aspect
review.name: Great filter

review.reviewBody: I used this filter on a week-long trip to Isle Royale. Being able to fill the bag, and let it hang waiting to be used was a great option. I always had water ready to cook with, fill my water bladder, top off water bottles, or clean up. I was always able to submerge the bag so it was never a challenge to fill, although you still have options when you can’t submerge completely. Easy to use. I quickly had my 14 year old up to speed on its function.
review.name: As close to indoor plumbing in the backcountry as it gets!

review.reviewBody: This filter is super easy to setup and holds a large amount of water. It filters water relatively quickly and is durable to tears and rips.
review.name: Intuitive Use

review.reviewBody: I would like for someone at the company to reach out to me if possible regarding the filters used.  I've used the Camp bag and the Hiker Pro both in Boundary Waters and they worked flowlessly with amazing flow and results.. however, back here in Indiana I've done multiple trips with my Scout Troop and the local reservoir we use for our water source clogs the filters in both of these units in one day.  I've tried everything over the last year to figure out how to resolve the issue, but the flow just stops after using a few times.
review.name: Depends on water quality.

review.reviewBody: Just returned from five days in the southern Canyonlands. Once we found a good water source, the filter worked great. We timed the filling of a three-liter bottle at about five minutes.
review.name: Filter worked great!

name: Gravity BeFree 6L Microfilter

description: Buy the Kuat Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kuat Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kuat Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Solid, heavy steel rack.  Easy to use, easy to install and remove.  I Like that nothing touches the bike frames.  Road bikes with higher air pressure are a little harder to secure, softer tires hold better.  I use rubber Voile straps on the wheels/wheel trays on highway trips, just for extra hold. On a long road trip, got into some snow and ice,  as mentioned in another review, the pistons iced up and wouldn’t operate.  Luckily, with some repacking I was able to get my bikes into the vehicle and the stuck-open arms cleared the sides of my 4Runner so I could flip the rack upright.  This rack chips easily from rocks etc, and the bare spots rust if you don’t put some touch up paint on, which Kuat doesn’t sell.  Kuat told me to touch it up with black paint, but the rack isn’t black.
review.name: Mostly good rack, two big issues

review.reviewBody: Everything I ever wanted out of a bike rack. Installation was easier than expected, did it in under an hour into a two inch trailer hitch, and removal is easy as heck other than it being heavy for some, wasn't a problem for me. The fastest most secure bike rack, takes seconds to load and unload everything from 29" 2.3 MTBs to 700x32 road bikes to 650b touring bikes and holds them steady on Interstate and gravel roads. Looks great, ingeniously designed, folds up to get out of the way and looks good. Signal lights work fantastic. And specifically on a Subaru Forester Wilderness edition, license plate is clear, rear camera is plenty visible, and it doesn't interfere with blindspot detection. We'll see how long the kashima piston arms last, but for now, as a former bike shop employee who has installed hundreds of racks of customers cars, this is the best rear rack I've ever come across. Some of the worries about wiring seems to have been revised with the model we received, no more magnetic interfaces. Modular arm designs means in future you should be able to replace troubled sections if needed.
review.name: Car bike rack of my dreams

review.reviewBody: The locking mechanisms fails in cold and snowy weather. Customer service says it’s a known issue and solution is carry a blow dryer or deicer. It will be okay to the trailhead but you open and take your bike off and then it won’t ratchet or lock down again so no way to get your bike home safely. Wiring failed as well in under a year. Each issue they’ll send replacement parts but expect you to fully rebuild the rack. For the money it’s not worth it! If you live in TX and never get things dirty, muddy, icy etc it’s probably great. Very disappointed in this product for the money.
review.name: Fails in cold weather , wiring fails

review.reviewBody:
I've had a bunch of racks. Recently 1-Up, Kuat NV, Thule T2 Pro XTR. I got rid of the 1-Up because it didn't really hold the front wheel very firmly, which resulted in the wheel wobbling back and forth rapidly in the wind, which is ultimately why I got rid of mine and switched to the hook style. Unfortunately, no matter what I did I couldn't get the hook of the Kuat or the Thule to not rub on the fork. This was particularly troublesome for a matte finish I have on one bike, which ended up getting polished, even with a rag in-between. 

So I decided to give this one a shot hoping it would have the convenience of the 1-Up rack, but with higher quality.  It really fits the bill. 

The wheel chocks it has are really substantial (not the little dinky bit that's on other racks) and holds the wheels really firmly.

My trail bike, even on the Thule T2 XTR, would wobble quite a bit just because of how big the bike is. The Piston Pro holds it completely solidly.

The pistons are cool, but probably pretty unnecessary. Maybe they'll come out with a non-piston version down the road.

I also like that the arms will open all the way to the ground. It really makes it easy to get bikes in and out, especially ones with a long wheel base.

I think the lights are also a big asset, especially the brake lights, in helping avoid getting rear ended.

Despite all the features and capabilities, the rack is actually pretty compact when folded up.

This rack really ticks all the boxes.
review.name: This rack is amazing

name: Piston Pro X Hitch Rack - 2-Bike

review.reviewBody: As simple as it look, is very detailed and the finish are very strong

review.reviewBody: All you need to do as a hunter is use the mystery ranch line of products weathers big game or just hiking around m mystery ranch has what you need the best packs on the market
review.name: Missed your ranch products

review.reviewBody:
Do yourself a favor and buy the set *first* and start experimenting with different pack configurations. I wish 20 years ago someone would have told me that you are supposed to pack smaller bags within your larger bag so that your stuff is not only organized logically, but doesn't explode into a congealed disaster of clothing and gear after moving the bag once.

The top portion is indeed translucent, but definitely not that super tacktile type plastic that will rip if you look at it wrong. The dimples take care of any snag points; great design.

Sometimes it takes seeing someone else do it correctly for you to facepalm and then totally change your methods. Try packing things by use case. For example, the largest cube holds my outdoor/woods/wilderness clothing very well. Get the full set so you have a true understanding of what it can be used for, and THEN order more individual bags as needed. Don't do what I have done sometimes and guess first, complain, then do it right the second time lol.
review.name: Do you ever travel?

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight. Hopefully doesn't correlate to durability. Time will tell. Fits all my first aid stuff for the backcountry.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Utilitarian, well designed and ideal size for packing/storage.
review.name: Excellent quality…

review.reviewBody: I have bought several different brands of interior storage bags over the years but nothing compares to the cubes. I can roll up clothing nice and tight inside the cubes and their ability to lay flat and stack inside my main travel bag is so crucial.
review.name: Truly packs better

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag a few weeks for some of my vlogging gear. It works perfectly. I have a gimble in it a small portable fog machine and a foldable air tube light. I absolutely love it. As I buy more blogging gear for my you tube channel I will buy another bag. This is my second mystery ranch bag. I also have the large Mission Control bag for my go pro and its accessories.
review.name: Perfect for my Vlogging gear

review.reviewBody: This makes it so quick and easy to find what I’m looking for in my Metcalf 100.  No more pulling everything out to get my socks, t shirts and other items.  I would highly recommend these if you like organization and efficiency.
review.name: Organize any bags content

review.reviewBody: The bag so nice I bought it twice. The easy to see through top is perfect for traveling. Love this bag
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Really great way to organize your gear in the bag and keep the digging or yard sale moments to a minimum. Great for keeping your kill kit together, first aid, filtration etc.
review.name: Pack Organized

name: Mission Packing Cube

review.reviewBody: This pack was overall very comfortable. The adjustments that can be made are nice. The back panel feels really comfortable while moving around and doesn't rub. When adjusted to your needs the weight stays pretty evenly distributed throughout the back. Doesn't put too much pressure on the waist area. The harness mesh was really comfortable on the curves of the body. My only downside to it was that it was not built for a girl with a football player stance in the shoulders, and it felt tight. Great bag, and I can see why this line of packs is popular.
review.name: Great For Hikes

review.reviewBody:
I recently hurt my back and needed to come up a bit on my road bike.
I looked around and found it difficult to find what I needed, most stems were either too high or the standard 6degree size.
Specialized saw the niche, and created stem with a 12 degree rise!
It is perfect! 
This is not an ultra light racing stem, but it's not to heavy either.
and is working well!
John S.

description: Buy the Roval Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Roval Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Roval Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Stumpjumper Expert. Swapped out the stock wheels and tires for the Royal Carbon wheel set and Specialized S-Works Fast Track tires. Bike is now over 2 pounds lighter - all rotating mass. My average speed on my typical route went from 11.3 mph to 12.8 mph, and my top speed (on the flats) increased from 18.0 to 22.4. I saved the stock beefy wheels and tires for future trail rides. Most of what I ride is "flow" and doesn't need the stock heavy casing wheels. My background is road bike riding, so those heavy downhill oriented wheels and tires just feel overkill. Your mileage may vary, as they say.

Anyway, the bike now feels much more lively. I picture it more of a XC/Flow/Trail Bike than anything else. If your full suspension trail bike feels portly - I'd recommend this wheel set. I honestly can feel the difference.
review.name: Solid Upgrade

name: Traverse SL II 350 Wheel - 29in

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had my eye on some other glasses for mountain biking.  Eventually saw a discussion online about the Smith chroma pop.  Backcountry had a deal and I went for it.  Far exceeded expectations.  The landscape and forest pop with the included rose lens.
review.name: Smith are one of the best for a reason

review.reviewBody: Great quality with the fit and build. Having the rose lenses is great for low light or even nighttime. Second pair of this model that I have owned due to the craftsmanship of the product. Will buy again if needed.
review.name: Great Sunnies

review.reviewBody: Highly disappointed with my first pair of Smith sunglasses. The nose piece broke and now I have two lens that are going in the trash. Smith doesn't have replacement parts, other brands do. Smith won't warranty scratches, other companies will. Only thing good about sunglasses were the chromepop (or whatever its called). These things scratched so easily, I was very surprised. I wanted to baby them - even though I got them for MTB/gravel biking - but they scratched right away. The arms and nose piece felt cheap and looked cheap because it was hard to clean around them. There is also no adjustability in the nose piece. Glasses would touch my eyelashes because the fit was weird. Google what sunglasses the Tour de France riders wear, no one wears Smith.... I will be switching to a new brand and will not be coming back to Smith. Sad because I am an Oregonian.
review.name: No Replacement Parts, Scratches Easily, Weird Fit

review.reviewBody: Really the best active sunglasses I've ever worn. They're extremely comfortable, they stay on my face, and they only fog up during super high output when it's raining. These are my go-to get-it-done eyewear.
review.name: Best Active Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I like the glasses a lot (comfortable, good coverage) but the nose piece is just so-so. I wish it were adjustable.
review.name: I like the glasses a

review.reviewBody: Outstanding fit and very comfortable glasses. I will be moving from Oakley to Smith glasses going forward.
review.name: Outstanding fit and very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I loved my pair so much I bought my partner a pair!
review.name: I loved my pair so

review.reviewBody: Great Cycling Lenses! Visibility and comfort exceptional. The lenses so easy to swap out.
review.name: Great Cycling Lenses! Visibility and

review.reviewBody:
Decent shades, but for the price they are lacking in two key areas:

While riding sunrise/sunset times the glare situation can get pretty bad. Next time I purchase shades with polarization. 

The ventilation is lacking. When riding the shades remain clear, but as soon as I stop, they begin to fog up almost immediately. I'm able to remedy this by wearing them a little further off my nose, but not ideal.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: Been a fantastic upgrade to my riding kit. The fit is excellent, and the changing lense is perfect for popping in and out of the sun/shade. Finally cured me of taking my old shades off and losing them whilst bombing through a shaded forest
review.name: Love ‘em!

name: Ruckus ChromaPop Sunglasses

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mackage Calina-R Down Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the style. I like many others in this style category, this is not boxy. It has a nice shape. The style and shape unfortunately, sacrificed the fit. Normally wear an XS or size 0, 32D bra.  I ordered one size up and it’s tight around the upper body.  You can feel the tightness in the upper arm when wearing a sweater. It’s beautiful but the fit is not great. Pricey to be uncomfortable.
review.name: Stylish but Runs small

review.reviewBody: Beautiful coat! I sized up as I outside Yellowstone national park and need lots of layers even under a good coat. I’m 5’6” 115lbs normally size 0 and went with a medium. I certainly could have gone with a small and probably had been fine too for a more fitted look so I agree with others it does run on the smaller side. Very light weight for a below the knee coat!
review.name: Fab coat!

review.reviewBody: I love the coat but the zipper is a real issue. Very difficult. I love it enough to keep it but for the price this should not be problem.
review.name: zipper issue

review.reviewBody: I am absolutely in love with this coat. It is exactly what I was looking for; very warm but lightweight, high quality construction and materials in a stylish and flattering fit, and it feels so good on. I've received so many compliments already! After reading the reviews, I ordered one size up (from XS to S)  and it fits perfectly. I'm 5'4" and love the length. As for the zipper, it took me a little while to get the hang of it, but have had no issues since.
review.name: In LOVE with my MACKAGE coat!

review.reviewBody: This is by far the very best coat I have ever owned.
review.name: 100% Everything

review.reviewBody: This is my first mackage as I am a Moncler lady and I am inlove. My husband picked this coat for me as I was looking for a fab winter coat. I have a small waist which is 29 and wide on the bottom and I got a large after reading reviews that they do run small. I pur hated it in the store so when I tried on the large it was perfect as I wanted to still have room. I took it for a test run today with the matching beanie and it was super warm. It will be 22 degrees in NYC tomorrow God willing so I will be prepared wearing my floor length Calina coat. This coat is for the grown ups that love to look chic and not bulky.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Beautiful look and fit.  Getting compliments left and right
review.name: Beautiful jacket with a great fit

review.reviewBody: Coat is beautiful! I haven't gotten the chance to wear it out yet but I've tried it on in the house a bunch of times. The fit is perfect. In Northface I generally wear a medium so I was nervous that the Mackage large would be too big. I'm really glad I went with a large, though, because the shoulders and upper body section are a bit narrow. The belt adds a really nice, feminine cinch at the waistline. The coat is expensive so I'm going to be judicious with when and where I wear it.
review.name: Very happy with this purchase!

review.reviewBody: This coat definitely keeps me warm and has a flattering fit for cold NYC days.  I also love wearing cream in a city where everyone is wearing black.  It changes the visual spectrum and is a mood pleaser.
review.name: Happy with my purchase.

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous coat and super warm. I am surprised by how light weight and warm this coat is.
review.name: I love this brand

name: Calina-R Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great hat, especially for people with big heads. Warm, well made, quiet (noisy hats are the worst…) Actually covers my ears and back of my head properly. I’ve never found a hat that fits as well as this one. Might look a bit silly but who cares? It’s awesome. AND it keeps the snow out of your eyes…! Some different colors would be nice but I’ll buy a few of these on the off chance they get discontinued.
review.name: The BEST

review.reviewBody: Do you have a giant cold head and work outside? This hat will fit you and keep you warm!
review.name: Big warm head

review.reviewBody:
I have 1" stretched ears and nothing keeps them warm. Beanies and headbands never cover my lobes so I'm always forced to wear hoods, which can get annoying when combined with my long hair.
This hat fixes all my problems. Wore it camping at 30° and got too hot while collecting firewood that I had to take it off. Once I sat down to relax, I put it on and it was perfect. If I get even colder, I can always throw a hood on over it as well. Love it.
review.name: Warm and comfy!

review.reviewBody: Kept head and especially ears nice and toasty. Love the hidden face cover which haven't had to use yet. Liked so much ordered as a birthday gift for a friend who walks his dogs in all types weather good or bad
review.name: great cold weather investment

review.reviewBody: I have many hats, and this will be one of my new favorites for cool weather-wear! I am normally a 7-3/8" hat size, which is Large by the size chart. It was too snug, so I returned it for a XL which fits much better. Just a touch loose, but that's better than too snug for comfort and warmth. The fit isn't poor, it just didn't align with the size chart. Can't wait to get some wear in this hat! I know it's a good hat, when my wife just shakes her head at me, ha!
review.name: Think about sizing up

review.reviewBody: I love the Whitefish Hats. Bought this to replace my last one. I wore it so much that the stitching around the snaps gave out. Super versatile and functional hat in any conditions, for everthing from nordic skiing to ice fishing.
review.name: I love this hat

review.reviewBody: Great for hunting i like having a beak its way more orange than the picture makes it seem but either way a great hat
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Now, I'm a fellow that knows hats, and this is a good one. What distinguishes it from other flap hats is the baseball style bill, so you get sun protection too. It's my go-to hat for snow shoeing and other out all day winter stuff. OR - keep making it and maybe offer some other colors. Thanks
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't ever loved beanies because they lack a brim for the sun, brimmed beanies never feel great, and just a hat is cold. A beanie over a hat has been my best solution until I found this! Its adjustability makes it perfect for cold days. I also love the break in the brim so you can store it in a pocket or pack w/o worries. Excited to have this in my collection for years to come!
review.name: Perfect Winter Hat

review.reviewBody: This hat is outstanding, and equally suitable for winter sports or casual wear. One of the features I particularly appreciate is the face cover, which effectively prevents my face from reflecting light during hunting trips. I'm incredibly fond of this hat and would confidently recommend it to anyone.
review.name: Amazing hunting winter hat

name: Whitefish Hat

review.reviewBody: Went for my first ride with these new grips. They are quite grippy and very comfortable. They feel way more comfortable than the stock grips that came with my MTB. I didn't do the most intense ride, but from my first ride, they felt great and didn't feel any numbness in hands, which I felt before with my stock grips. Also, getting a color that matches the bike looks great!
review.name: comfy and grippy

review.reviewBody: I ordered the mid summer blue because in the pictures it looks like yeti turquoise. It is not turquoise, it is more like a Duke Blue Devil's blue.  I did some digging around the web and looks like at some point Ergon changed the shade of blue and no longer offers a yeti turquoise.
review.name: Color is not as pictured

review.reviewBody: I bought these to get a larger grip version of the Ergons.  I've been running GA3 (small wings) for about 3 years and decided to get something larger as the GA3 have felt small at times.  I read review about their good vibration dampening so I decided to try these over the ESI Extra Chunky.  I should have gone with the ESI.  These grips are noticeably larger than the GA3, but the rubber feels the same thickness.  My hand that normally goes a little numb on a ride was completely numb.  I tried different grip positions, but couldn't find a comfortable one to use with these.  It felt like a large, hard plastic grip with a thin rubber overcoat.  Just not what I expected from Ergon.   The GA3 are good grips.  If you want something thicker, go with the ESI.
review.name: Thicker Grips but No Extra Squish

review.reviewBody: I returned the first one i got because the left grip would occasionally rotate or creak. The movement was very very minor but enough to make you think about it... Returned it with no issues for a full refund (thank you!). I switched back to my old grips but decided i liked the ergons more so bought another pair... and guess what, same issue. I've decided to put up with it as they work better with my broken wrist than my previous favs (the ODIs).
review.name: Good but weird creak on left grip

review.reviewBody: Probably the most comfortable lock on grips I have tried. They dampen vibrations, and feel great in the hand. The vibration damping has a drawback as it mutes the feedback you feel through the bars, but it is a worthwhile trade.
review.name: Extremely comfortable.

review.reviewBody: It's like I've found my soulmate.  After a couple decades of mountain biking I've finally, FINALLY landed on a grip that's completely comfortable.  I've got big hands, and typically wear XL-XXL gloves.  Bought the GA2 Fats, and headed out for a multi-day mission.  I didn't even realize until half way through the second day... my hands still had feeling!  It was glorious.  No more finding 10 feet of flat to shake blood into my fingertips.  No more sketchy descents where I couldn't feel my brake levers.  Nope, just comfort.  They offer ample cush, and tons of grip.  I'm yours forever.
review.name: True love

review.reviewBody: These definitely inspire a little bit of confidence, coming from simple stock grips. I initially went for these because of the color. I have a Voile strap and pedals that match in color so I wanted new handlebar grips to match as well, and the picture on here (and on the Ergon website) definitely shows a lighter blue (one might call it cyan). It is definitely NOT a light blue at all. It is very much a navy blue. Good thing these grips are so nice. So I'll keep them.
review.name: Color not as expected

review.reviewBody: I already thought the GA2s were the best grip on the market after trying many alternatives (ESI, ODI, ect.), but having tried the FAT version, I have a new favorite. I have larger hands, but by no means enormous and these are great.
review.name: Best Grips I've used

name: GA2 Grips

review.reviewBody:
I am fit, 6 foot, 170lbs and the medium fits perfectly. If you’re anywhere close to my size I bet the large would be too big. Love the pockets and the style overall.

These bibs are sick but I ordered the Slate color and they sent me the Night color. Too lazy to go through with the reordering process but come on guys. Be better.
review.name: Great bibs

review.reviewBody: I am 6'0", 210#, 34 in waist with a "normal" shape although my legs are on the thinner size. I ordered a Large based on sizing chart.  The fit on these bibs was nothing even close to a correct fit.  Extremely tight around the waist, however, the legs were oversized leading down to ginormous bell-bottoms.  I wish I had looked at the reviews better but that one is on me.  Make sure you do because you'll have to pay $6.99 to return ship a poorly designed & ill-fitting piece of gear.  On a positive note, the material was pretty nice and the zipper design and layout seemed well though out.
review.name: Odd Fit, Strange Cut

review.reviewBody: Legs are ridiculously long and are so oversized, particularly at the cuff you'd look like an idiot wearing these; not to mention you'd catch skis, brakes, etc. on the excessive fabric around the boot.
review.name: only if you ski in bell-bottoms

review.reviewBody: The insulation is just perfect, not too much, but better than a shell alone.  Not bulky.   Pockets are well placed and the right size for stuff, so that is about perfect.  Length is perfect (5'10" 160# in a M), and the L would be much too long.  But the cut is a little strange. The legs, waist and butt all seem just right, but the bib section is pretty snug right above the waist, then almost baggy at the top.  I'm pretty lean--not exactly 6-pack abs--but on the skinny side.  It would be nice to have had a little more space.  There are velcro adjusters to pull it tighter around the middle, but tightening it up wasn't the goal.  If you have any kind of a gut or even a minor muffin top, they may not be comfortable.  A real beer gut and you won't be able to get them on.  Once I was skiing in them, it was comfortable and didn't feel tight or binding.  But most bibs I've used allow a little room for lunch, or even layering up on a cold day.  So 3 stars--credit for pockets, vents, insulation, and penalty for being too snug in the middle of the bib.
review.name: Strange cut

review.reviewBody: Great insulated, fairly light weighted bib for resort. The mid section is a bit tight, but it is not a deal breaker. Plenty of room around legs, thighs and butt.
review.name: Great resort bib

review.reviewBody: I mean if you want a pair of thin bibs that look nothing the the ones in the pictures then sure go ahead and get these. Fit is terrible. I am 5?9 170 athletic build and the mid section is tight. They run a bit long and the actual leg parts of the pants are massive. Like I could fit both legs in one. Also they are bell bottoms which look nothing like it does in the picture.
review.name: Absolute Gar

review.reviewBody: I am 170lb, fit, 6ft. I ordered a Medium and Large and the Large was way too big. Medium is good size. Loose enough so when you squat, you have enough space even if you are wearing base layer.
review.name: Fits True To Size

review.reviewBody:
As a woman, I bought these for myself, because it seems like a lot of women?s bibs are too fitted with not enough wiggle room. Bibs should be comfortable! Why companies keep making fitted ski gear for women is beyond me.  I prefer a looser, more relaxed fit in ski pants and these bibs do the job. 

I?m 5?7?? and weigh 143 lbs, and the small fit great. They were a tad long but I was able to cinch them up with the suspenders just fine. 

They?re comfortable and appear high quality. The insulation is on the cool side but I like that they?re not just a shell. Can?t wait to wear them cat skiing in two weeks!
review.name: Great fitting bibs, even for women

review.reviewBody: Our first (and warmest) insulated bib.
review.name: Snowman BIB video

name: Snowman Bib Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Merino 150 Sensor Glove Liner online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Merino 150 Sensor Glove Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Merino 150 Sensor Glove Liner online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent for running or liners to keep extra warm.

Thin and lightweight but keep your hands warm when you remove your hands from your gloves when handling other gear and helps keep your hands warm if your gloves get soaked through. Only complaint is the material is rather thin so it gets torn easily.

The weight is good - the perfect weight of thinness; the touch sensitivity is just "OK." The sensor material is really only in the little seams at the fingertips and the fingers are pretty long - especially for the XS size - so you have to pull the excess material on the fingers down close to the fingertips, otherwise it's tricky to get them to work. If you have excessively long fingers, these will be great for you (I DO have long fingers, but not quite long enough for these, evidently).
review.name: Great if you have *really* long fingers.

review.reviewBody: I like 'em. Especially when I need to mess on my phone a bit and don't want to take off my gloves in snapp-ish weather.
review.name: Great little pair of liner gloves

review.reviewBody: great liner - keeps your hands warm & makes for easy washing
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I've had a few pairs of liner gloves from other companies and they usually rip wicked quick, but not these! Awesome gloves- love how thin they are, love the tech finger tips, and love the fit!
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: True to size. Very thin. They work great with the OR tactical shells, and touch screen feature works very well.
review.name: As described.

review.reviewBody: I use these as an insulating layer, then add one or sometimes two nitrile (latex style) waterproof gloves over these. I can still grip fly lines, and have enough feel to stay connected to the big bite when it comes. The nitrile gloves are still touch screen friendly, and provide the waterproofing layer needed to keep dry, while the merino wool delivers the insulation. Spot on for me.
review.name: Best under nitrile gloves for winter flyfishing activity!

review.reviewBody: First time purchase and I love them. Once I get moving around in the cold seasons (Midwest states) my hands get plenty warm so I enjoy a lightweight layer compared to a bulky glove. The sensors work great on my phone and fit is true to size. If its a cold day or night and I'm moving less they fit great under a heavy mitt.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I used this product in a winter field exercice. It fits it's description perfectly as a liner under my Gortex Gloves; It kept my hands warm and my dexterity proper (Temperature was around - 16 C). Also I used the product as a standalone in -5 C and it worked properly; especially while doing light activities (hike / Snowshoe walk / Survival chores). If wet it dries out quickly which is good if you winter camping. However as a standalone, it has no Windproof and not very durable against abrasive chores (log chopping).
review.name: Impressive product

name: Merino 150 Sensor Glove Liner

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Victory Patio Blanket online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Victory Patio Blanket
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Victory Patio Blanket online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used on two occasions -- as a picnic blanket and then at an outdoor concert.  The concert saw a lot of rain and this was pretty clutch to keeping dry.  We turned it upside down so the water resistant part / black bottom was a throw over poncho blanket.  We managed to keep pretty dry.  Pretty rugged, the blanket is kind of a plastic-y material/weave.  The buckles have been fine so far. Roll up feature is nice.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: A picnic blanket that can’t be thoroughly washed… need I say more? Mine hasn’t survived a summer’s worth of use.
review.name: Can’t be machine washed
comment: Thanks for leaving a review! Our CS team will reach out to you for more info and see how we can help!

review.reviewBody: I got this blanket to use for camping, events and the like.  Its a really nice material that wipes off easy and does not hold onto dirt.  The underside keep dampness from coming through.  And its super easy to roll up and put away.  I like that it does not have to stuff into a sack and its super easy to roll up and put away.  It is heavy, so its not something for a backpack or multiday raft trip.
review.name: I love this blanket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this a week ago and was in love with it when I opened it, after looking this thing over almost all of the seams are loose and the straps are barely holding but when I cinched down the blanket to put it away the buttons broke. So within the first 5 minutes of having this and I can't close it back up and it's coming apart at the seams literally. Would not buy this, save your money and find something better quality
review.name: Terrible quality

review.reviewBody: I purchased this with the intention of using it with my family. I bought this and the first day that I got blanket out it opened up and everything was amazing. As soon as I went to fold it up I noticed the seams around the edges and straps were coming looses. Upon looking it over I then go to roll up the blanket and as I use the straps and buttons to roll it up the button busted. Needless to say it's seen a front yard once and is already threadbare and broken. If you have money to throw away then buy this but otherwise save it for something that will last
review.name: Poor quality from start to finish

review.reviewBody: This outdoor blanket sets the bar much higher than any other outdoor blanket in the market. Its perfect for camping even in the dirtiest and most dusty situations. Its easy to wipe off, nothing clings, its easy to pack and roll up. This will be an essential item for grass concerts, festivals and all camping both for us and for Hazel!
review.name: Outdoor Blanket Dream!

review.reviewBody: We use this as a pad for changing into and out of skiing gear. The waterproof back keeps moisture and cold off your feet while changing.
review.name: Makes a great blanket for the snow.

review.reviewBody: This blanket is great until to gets so dirty it needs to be cleaned throughly.  The spot cleaning method is laughable for such an item.  Spend a few bucks more and get a picnic blanket that can be machine washed AND dried.  Cheers...nice try...but your product failed my real world field testing.
review.name: Unable to clean properly

review.reviewBody: Love this patio blanket. Very durable and adds a nice splash of color. Easy to clean off and put away.
review.name: Camper-Van Must Have

review.reviewBody: This blanket is awful. It is supposedly a picnic blanket but cannot go in the washing machine and can only be spot cleaned. It feels great but I would never ever buy it again. Like, you spill coffee? Get sand on it from the beach, or mud from the park? Sorry, "spot clean" it. I have never written a review before of a product; that's how bad this blanket it. I strongly advise against buying it, I wish I didn't have it, and am looking for a new blanket.
review.name: Worst "picnic" blanket ever

name: Victory Patio Blanket

description: Buy the Elite Nero Interactive Rollers online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nero Interactive Rollers
hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Nero Interactive Rollers online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
So yeah, I really feel like I need to tell someone about these because they are awesome.  I guess I?ll start of by saying that I absolutely hate trainers.  Turbo?s are too stiff, and rollers require too much paying attention or you do an epic crash.  The Nero Rollers are the first trainer I?ve ever used that I actually like.

From the beginning, the unboxing was simple.  They come fully assembled and only need folded out and adjusted for your bikes wheel base.  It is the same as any other roller in this respect.  The front axle goes over or just behind the front roller.  Once this is done, you can actually ride if you want to.

For the interactive (smart) part, it?s super simple.  Plug the supplied cord into the rollers and pair them up to the program of your choice.  I used zwift via my iPhone.  It is worth mentioning that the power output accuracy on this trainer isn?t supposed to be great.  I honestly never tried it because the trainer automatically searched for and linked with my Assioma power meter pedals, and used them as a default for setting itself.  The trainer worked quite well with zwift.  There was a slight delay between the screen and the felt resistance on the trainer, but not much.  Since I don?t watch the screen that closely, it?s not going to bother me a bit.

I guess for the part that really sold me on these...  The ride quality is great!  These aren?t you daddy?s rollers.  Unlike every set of rollers that I?ve been on, these don?t try to trow you off just because you reach for your water bottle.  You can even ride out of the saddle!  Don?t get me wrong, you can still crash, but it?s noting like a typical set of rollers.  The bike simply feels like a bike on these, and with the interactive programs available, these are as close to riding outdoors as I?ve ever found.
review.name: Closest ever to a real road feel

name: Nero Interactive Rollers
