review.reviewBody: I’m on my feet all day and these are perfect! Even ran a 2 miles in them.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: So this is my 3ird pair of Astral Shoes. I had first the TR1 mesh, then went with the brewer. This time I wanted a more protective shoe for walking in rivers as a rafting guide. This shoe deliverd. Comfy and just high enough in the back to stay on the foot and protect the sensitive part. But, to me it feels the sole is different from the 2 others model. It feels that it's slipping more.  The ohers thing is like the others shoes, they don't last. not even half a season before i can see it start to brake aways. I like the warranty service but  sorry Astral it's not in my value to buy a new pair of shoe each season.
review.name: review from a professional rafting guide

review.reviewBody: Like every pair of Astral shoes I've owned, these are made well with great materials. The soles are nice and sticky and this plus the ability to lace them up higher than other water shoes gives me a lot of confidence moving on wet rocks. The high-top with low-cut back is a great combination that makes a lot of sense on the water/in a boat. These are comfortable, and look great too. The biggest thing I needed to get used to was the volume - these are kinda "tight" at first. It makes a lot of sense because you don't want a loose, sloppy shoe where you foot rolls around inside when you're trying to squeeze them into a boat, or scramble around the river. It's not uncomfortable, but worth trying on for fit before you buy; this might feel different than other Astral's you've tried in the past. All in all, GREAT shoes and would recommend for a variety of uses.
review.name: Functional and stylish shoes

review.reviewBody: Fit is good.  Size was correct. comfortable with or without socks.  Have used them in very wet conditions in my yard and in car washing.  Have not yet had a chance to use them kayaking or wade fishing--YET.  Will do.  The soles really do NOT slip!    I like the way the back of the shoe cradles your heel,  they don't slip.  But that does make them a little bit hard to  put on.  JMW
review.name: Rassler

review.reviewBody:
I bought these used online about a year and a half ago to wear for work (I'm a fish biologist and work in  water a fair amount).  I got these to wear for field work that I am getting in and out of boats a lot and needed a water shoe that wouldn't come off easily when I step in mud and wouldn't let in small rocks so I wouldn't have to constantly be taking off and emptying my shoes.  I tried the Webbers for this at first but they're not so great at toe protection.  Dropping the anchor on my toe once was all I needed to look for something close-toed.  The Rassler works well in the foot protection department and has good grip on slippery rocks.  I do need to really tie them pretty tight to keep small rocks out so I do have to take them off and empty them at least once (even if I think they're tied tight enough, once they get wet they loosen up) which I don't love but that's what gravel guards are for I guess. I also love the look of these shoes (I didn't know I could love the look of a shoe so much until I discovered Astral) and the wide toe box is also great.  The little bit of extra ankle support is also helpful without too much restriction.
Aside from that my only negative is that I wish there was more cushioning.  I have foot issues and I stand most of the day wearing these.  I didn't think water shoe insoles existed but I did find a pair that add a little cushion and don't just turn into a wet sponge to make wearing them a little more bearable (I also bought these about 2 sizes too big so the insoles fit and actually make the shoe fit, too).
review.name: Great for Working in the Water

review.reviewBody: Hassles 2.0 is a great, light, comfortable water shoe. I wear an 11.5 and it is true to size. My old water shoes were bulky and I had a difficult time getting my feet with shoes on inside my cockpit, under my deck. These shoes must have a smaller profile because my feet fit better now inside my boat. I recommend these shoes to kayakers
review.name: Great shoe for sit-inside, touring kayak.

review.reviewBody: The rasslers are a good pair of water shoes as far as the high ankle support and the grip on rocks goes. I’ve had now 4 pair of these same shoes and with each new pair, about 2 or 3 weeks into wearing them they fall apart. The sole of the shoe comes apart from the shoe itself. Besides that I love the show but it would be nice to not have to pay for a new pair every month because the glue is so cheap
review.name: Good shoe, made poorly

review.reviewBody: Boots run small - overall like them but wish the sizing was better.
review.name: Need to size up!

review.reviewBody: I like to fish in small Sierra streams - I switched from Simms wading boots to the Rasslers and have found that I can hike up river and fish all day without my legs getting tired.   Fit true to size, and Simms wading socks fit well as a combo.  Grips not as good as studded felt soled fishing boots, but good enough once you learn to trust the flex in the sole.    Great shoes!
review.name: Good for back country fly fishing

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable very high quality! I use these for rope and water rescue. I love them!
review.name: Great quality, worth every penny!

name: Rassler 2.0 Water Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Great shoes! They run just a little small.
Will reorder 1/2 size larger, love them.
review.name: Great shoes, run a little small

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased the Vasque Talus AT due to having two Vasque boots in the past that have proven their fit and longevity. Initially found the the boots to be tight in the little toe area from the side and top. Hopefully, with continuous usage, the material will soften and become more flexible since a wide width for 11/11.5 is hard to find.
review.name: Still breaking them in

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: After a few lacing adjustments and some break in time I found this boot to be well-fitting. The sole is grippy the tongue is fully gusseted and overall should be good for average trail use and/or urban hiking. Will recommend and buy again.
review.name: Comfortable Fit

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: So glad I bought these boots for a fall trip to Iceland. They were warm, durable,  fairly comfortable and provided good traction in snow and wet rocky trails. I am confident they will give me years of use... and they even look great.
review.name: Handled the rugged terrain of Iceland

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots have agreat fit and feel. Light weight and yet very supportive. They required very little break in time.
review.name: Bes5 boots I have had in years

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had the pleasure of reviewing a pair and they performed great! https://theclassicsurvivalist.com/review-vasque-talus-at-ultradry-hiking-boots/
review.name: Great boots!
comment: Hello! Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear the footwear have lived up to your expectations! Take care!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn these every day for one year, awesome pair of boots. Do not be fooled by the spam 1 star reviews. The Talus AT Ultradry have been lightweight, rugged, and comfortable. Have hiked 10 miles with a pack no problem. Laces and loops have held up great. Sole has minimal wear. When these finally wear out I will be buying the same pair again.
review.name: Favorite Boots. 1 year wearing so far.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are comfortable and they won't wear your feet out at the end of the day. The soles grip wet and mossy rocks and the overall ankle support is amazing .  Any pair of Vasque a person orders will be the best shoes or boots one can buy..
review.name: Outstanding comfort reliable durability
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The pros: comfortable right out of the box, ready to spend all day in them! They were also reliably waterproof, even in thes PNW winters when everything is soaking wet. 

The cons: the tread/sole simply did not hold up. Within 6 months (of moderate use) I had holes in the soles and then, well, they're certainly a lot less waterproof. 

I loved the look and comfort, but need something that can actually withstand a proper hike.
review.name: Pros and Cons
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots in the fall of 2022. I live in the Deep South and find them to be extremely hot during the summer. I only wear these boots in the winter. I have worn these boots on 2 rainy days only to walk around with wet feet. I feel like with the name ultradry that should never happen. I have worn Redwings for 23 years and wanted to try there hiking boot line. I understand a waterproof boot may be warm but this boot does not keep my feet dry.
review.name: Very disappointed
comment: Hi, thanks for leaving your feedback. I am sorry to hear your boots are not working out for you. I have sent you an email to gather more information regarding this and will further assist you there.

name: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Stoney HS Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Stoney HS Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these for resort skiing, the waterproofing is excellent. The vents work incredibly well. I am 5’10 170lbs and got the 32 waist and regular length pants and they fit snug around my hips but perfectly for me. If you wear regular pants in a size 32 but you want to be able to layer more and less body hugging I would go a size up. I just wear a thin thermal layer underneath and they’ve been warm enough for mid season skiing in Alaska.
review.name: Great for resort skiing

review.reviewBody: They fit perfectly, slimmer than some other options. The only slightly strange thing about these is the pockets; they are not all that deep, but large enough for something like a wallet or a smaller phone. As someone else mentioned, there is some light insulation, but that is fine for resort skiing.
review.name: Great slimmer fitting option

review.reviewBody:
These pants are smartly designed and constructed, high quality, and fit great. (I'm 5'10", 165 pounds, and the size 32s were tailored but comfortable.) Unfortunately, the description doesn't accurately represent them so I have to send them back.

While ordering, I noted that despite the product description that says these are exclusively a shell, several customer reviews mentioned a built-in, insulating liner. I need these pants for skinning and backcountry, so I only need a shell—built-in insulation would be too much for high-output. As such, I contacted Backcountry Customer Service, and the representative assured me these were a shell only, no insulation. When I pressed to be sure, the agent said that the reviews were probably for a different pant and that the reviewers who said they had insulation were wrong. So I ordered them.

On receipt, I'm disappointed to find that these pants do in fact have a light insulating interior layer. They would be great for resort skiing. But unless you are an extremely cold person or plan to ski with nothing under these pants, they are likely going to be too heavy for any aerobic use.

Again, they are awesome looking pants. But don't be misled: they are NOT just a shell; they definitely have a light insulating layer inside.
review.name: MORE Than Just A Shell

review.reviewBody:
These are great ski pants for cold, snowy or wet conditions. Their only shortcoming is that they are on the warm side for a shell pant, because the inside liner (they are 2 layer, not 3 layer) is quite warm. That said, they have excellent outside leg vents, and I run hot, so this will be a non-issue for most folks (and for me, except in the spring).

I have worn these in cold and windy and warm and sunny conditions and they have performed admirably. They are very comfortable, fit really well (size S, I am 5’6” and 145lbs) and look great.
review.name: great pants

review.reviewBody: Warm, dry, durable/well constructed, great pockets/vents.

Love the pants, super nice like all Mamut gear with thoughtful features and great materials.  But, take heed yee of "athletic" proportions! I'm a thin, skinny-legged 6'2 with the 34 and if I had manly quads there is no way these would fit.  Size up.  As is, they are great for me but it's *close*.
review.name: Super nice pant, definitely a "Euro" cut

review.reviewBody: Pants fit true to size. I'm a 30 in regular pants and the stoney size 30 fits perfectly. They are a little warmer than other shell pants I have owned in the past. Overall, the most comfortable pants I have ever owned. I would recommend these for resort and bc use. Although, the pants do not come with a built in transceiver attachment. The vents are very useful on the ups, and the extra warmth helps on the downs.
review.name: Very comfy and versatile

review.reviewBody: I was able to get a size than fit me well. Many other pants are too long and baggy but the Short fitting is great for me (5'9"). The pants are warm, comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Great Pants

review.reviewBody:
I have only used the pants for resort skiing so far, but I have taken them through all sorts of terrain in weather from -10 centigrade to 0 centigrade. Not only are they extremely comfortable, flexible and light, my temperature has been maintained perfectly. The pockets themselves on the front are small and cannot hold much, and I have opted instead to use my jacket pockets instead for comfort reasons.

Overall, extremely satisfied and can't wait to try them touring.
review.name: Flexible, beathable, and durable.

review.reviewBody:
My first pair of Mammut bottoms and the one thing I wish I had done was read more reviews on the item's actual product page. I'm 6'2, 185 but athletically built. So while I'm not popping out like Arnold or CBum, the pants are snug around the hips. 
When I initially put them on, my immediate thought was that I'm jacked(not in the good way) coz they felt tight coming up, and this was with no base/mid layer underneath. I still had a butt-pad to fit in. The front of it was pushing down on my jewels already.

A few weeks in, I have been riding in these with a butt pad on and there has honestly been 0 discomfort. They have some stretch to them which has certainly helped. I dont use the pockets at all. And so far, I haven't had to use a base layer. They have insulation which has served well. They've also held their own in a couple PNW downpours and he waterproofing is solid.

My rating of 9/10 was only because of how slim they run. I picked a size 34 since I am a 32 and figured 36 might be too loose. Even with the 34, I use the waist adjustment all the way and have tonnes of room everywhere but the hips.

All that said, if you are looking at these, pay a little extra attention to the measurements before you buy it, but buy it.

name: Stoney HS Pant - Men's

This is my 4th pack from them and couldn’t be happier with alll of them. We have a toddler and I’m looking forward to having both hands free in airports now.
review.name: Haven’t used it for a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just used my fair point 40 and the day pack for a trip to Europe. London,Zurich,Interlaken,Paris and Omaha Beach. I had zero issues flying without checking my bags. We did a lot of train transfers and walked a whole bunch with our gear. It was easy to use and very comfortable to wear. I have no cons about this set up. I am going to get my wife a rig like it. Switching from backpack to carry satchel is effortless and vise versa. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: I just used my fair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I took the Farpoint as my one bag on a four-stop, two week trip to Greece. The pack was phenomenal. I had no issues with taking it as a carry-on on any airline. Packing the bag is straightforward and intuitive. The carry comfort is the best I have experienced and excellent for navigating the many steps and hills encountered during my trip. Overall, this is the best travel pack I have used.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this 5 years ago for trip to Europe so I could take everything as carry on. Size is good but the zippers catch and just don’t work as efficiently as other packs I own. I really wish companies would not send manufacturing overseas, as the quality of USA made products are just so much better. I’d be happy to pay 20-30% if items were made in the U.S. I usually revert back to my old MountainSmith from the early 90’s that was made stateside and zippers work great after 30 years. Sincerely, 
Stop sending jobs overseas!!!!
review.name: 5 years and still the zippers are sub par.

review.reviewBody:
Thoughtful well designed pack and day pack system. Great for long weekend travels via ground and air. Multipurpose capable luggage pack with the removable day pack design. The straps through straps is annoying efficient enough. Hopefully they are durable long term but imagine to be weak point with the amount of use they will see long term. I was able to get into enough storage compartments and zips without taking things apart while in an airport for access to all travel items. A larger item such as a laptop would require multiple straps and zips to be undone/redone. Very doable in a tight space albeit inefficiency in general.  The pack looks indistinguishable from other mainstream luggage which attracts less attention. The padded carry handles allowed me to not need to deploy harness/shoulder straps on multiple occasions while fully loaded on a few occasions and while walking 1-2 miles through airports. 

The day pack is great for light quick carry. It lacks a waist strap for anything more than basic activity uses. I also with the outer fabric was more water resistant or fully waterproof. That's never issue until it is.
review.name: Near Perfect Carry-On+

review.reviewBody: I recently used the Farpoint 55 on a 10 day trip across France. The main bag had plenty of room for all of my clothing and a spare pair of shoes. The day pack was great for stashing a few extra layers and keeping my essentials accessible. Love the ability to carry the entire unit as one backpack, convert the main bag to a carry-on and hide all the straps, as well as front carry the day pack. I used all three configurations on my trip. So glad I went with this over a roller bag.
review.name: A Great Travel Bag Setup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the travel pack, and the little pack is awesome for day tripping.
review.name: Love the travel pack, and

review.reviewBody: This completely changed air travel for me. I fly weekly for business and check two huge rolling Pelican cases and this thing is a game changer for my personal stuff!! I no longer have to rig up a way in and out of the airport for my carryon roller bag because it has assumed its new permanent residence in a closet. I don't have to take up space in one of the Pelican cases anymore with the 55L pack that I carried the stuff in the cases to demo's with as I do so with the main main pack of the Fairpoint and my computer and stuff is sitll in the daypack. The Fairpoint 55 made air travel easier than I imagined possible. The way the flap on the back of the main pack zips the straps up for overhead bin storage makes tight spaces in the overhead bin possible and easy. The handles on the side and top are extremely comfortable for carrying by hand when the straps are stowed. The way the day pack nests in the back of the main pack makes TSA easy if you have precheck you just put one bag on the belt and don't take anything out it's just easy. I thought the pictures of the day pack hanging off the front straps looking like a reserve parachute were a little goofy and who would carry it like that but let me tell you when I had a few minutes to make a connecting flight I did it as I was waiting to get off the first plane and it was comfortable and easy darting through airport congestion to make my flight. It's an Osprey pack so it's just flat out comfortable on your back with the multiple adjustment points it fits like a glove. Osprey knocked it out of the park with this one!!!!! Kudos to the designers!!!!
review.name: It's a trail pack with table manners!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Currently using this bag for a 6 week trip through Europe. It packs more than enough and is easy to carry. Love both the combination with the small pack into a single bag and the quick transformation into a carryon style.
review.name: Currently using this bag for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's nice but my wife also got one and had a lot of issues with it. I'd love to see if we can make it better for her. If someone wanted to email me directly, that would be awesome!
review.name: It's nice but my wife

review.reviewBody: I bought this set for a trip back in 2013 but the attached daypack has been my go to bag for class, the office, hikes, and short weekend trips. I needed to replace the Zipper pulls last year after they finally broke, but Osprey sent me new ones for free!
review.name: The daypack has crushed it for 11 years

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic pack. Should traps and hip belt have been upgraded nicely.
review.name: Fantastic pack. Should traps and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent bags. I'm getting this because my old Porter 46 isn't quite big enough for some trips, and I also have always thought that that design should have had the attached day pack like this one does (that one, incidentally is at least 10 years old and still in perfect condition despite really heavy use). The only thing I miss is the accessory pocket on the top of the porter - please consider adding one on the next version!
review.name: Excellent bags. I'm getting this

review.reviewBody:
These fit perfectly with my Aequilibrium LTs on a climb up Mt Hood. Super easy to put on, dial in the fit, and forget about them while climbing up. 

If I'm being overly picky and trying to find one issue to call out (and this is a SUPER small thing) it would be the straps are a bit long. Yeah that's a stretch to call out an issue but that's the only thing I can think of. 

If you're looking at these...buy em. You won't be disappointed.
review.name: Fantastic lightweight crampons

review.reviewBody:
The G12 Evo looks like a great crampon, but unfortunately it's not compatible with the La Sportiva Olympus Mons Cube boot. At all. There is no compatibility chart to prevent making this mistake.

My boot is a US 12-1/2 (EU 46-1/2). I got the Cramp-O-Matic version of the G12 Evo hoping to use it on both the Oly Mons and my AT ski boots. The Grivel spec sheet shows that it should work. It doesn't.

The G12 Eco wouldn't fit the Oly Mons for 4 reasons: 

1) The center bar is too short: at full extension it was still 1/4" or more too short for the sole. The spec sheet says it fits up to size EU 47, but nonetheless it didn't.

2) The toe bail is too narrow: the loops on the bail dig into the front of the boot so the front of the bail doesn't fit snugly on the toe lug. The bail floated about 3/16"+ off the lug because of this. Pulling it tight still didn't snug it, and the way it was digging in, it looked like it was going to damage the boot.

3) The crampon heel is too narrow: the two vertical rear lugs are narrower than the boot sole, so even if everything else worked, you'd be standing on the lugs, likely causing boot  damage, and the crampon would never sit flush with the boot sole.

4) The rear bail is far too short for the sole thickness: at the maximum length, the cam locking mechanism couldn't possibly work, so even if the heel lugs mentioned above weren't an issue, you couldn't attach the crampon to the boot.

So... 4 strikes, you're out. Nothing fit. I don't think it would work with a smaller boot size due to the boot's width and sole thickness. 

Really wish there was a compatibility chart for crampons. Any chance of that Backcountry?
review.name: Incompatible with Olympus Mons Cube

name: G12 Evo Crampon

review.itemreviewed: Summer LT UPF Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use the shirt for trail running. The second time I wore the shirt the flatlock stitch on the sleeve got snagged on a branch and it pulled the thread out about four inches. The light color doesn't seem to wash clean even in hot water. I probably wouldn't buy it again.
review.name: Not very durable

review.itemreviewed: Summer LT UPF Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use this short-sleeved shirt to sleep in at night. The material is very light weight so it doesn't make you sweat at night. The weave/pattern is airy and moves with you easily. My only dislike is the material is so fine and light that it snags very easily and leaves strands of thread like material hanging out, which are very difficult to stretch back into place.
review.name: Nice, light and airy but...

review.itemreviewed: Summer LT UPF Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love this shirt. The fit is great, NF rates this as "slim fit" but it's not overly slim and form fitting (I'm 6'2" 190lbs and the L fits me perfectly). The weight of the shirt is light but not "too light". I don't like shirts that are like almost a silky material. Breathes great, just did my first 5k trail run in it and loved it. Dries fast, love the look and feel of it. Might order another!
review.name: Great shirt! Perfect fit and fabric (for me)

review.itemreviewed: Summer LT UPF Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and breathable but extremely see-through. Size is slim fitting.
review.name: See -through

name: Summer LT UPF Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Saris MHS Duo 1-Bike Add-On online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MHS Duo 1-Bike Add-On
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris MHS Duo 1-Bike Add-On online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent bike rack. Safe reliable system. Easy to load bike on and off.
review.name: Easy to load ebike.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic build quality, easy to load your bikes and absolutely no part of the securing arms touches your bike unlike most of the other rack systems.
review.name: The only rack system I use or will sell in my shop

review.reviewBody:
I really like the general design of the "no touch" trays like Saris uses for this product. I have had a couple different brands and like them all. The Saris is a very solid offering with long tray to accommodate larger bikes. I have even seen a tandem on this rack although I don’t think its recommended. 

The long tray, while offering space for long wheel base bikes with large tires also created a small challenge in accommodating smaller bikes.  The support cross bars have to be moved down a bit and the wheel block found in the tray is stationary. I think this is just a change from what I am accustomed to as it works perfectly well, but it seems unnecessary and fixes the bike position by blocking the front wheel. If the wheel block were not there or adjustable, it would allow moving bikes forward and aft to keep bars and saddles from touching.

I am still completely on board for this product, it is super solid in the hitch with very little movement and the bikes are securely held. The add-on works great, solid and easy to install. The system is a bit heavy but that’s what you get for solid at a good price. The versatility is also pretty interesting. The additional engineering to make a modular system is a bonus. Built in locks are a super handy feature often overlooked! Lastly, “Made Here” is a good thing these days.

Usage: I work in the Bike industry and often carry 5 bikes inside my T&C and now can move/add three to the hitch. I am driving to events and supporting races and rides with SAG, media and also support racers as well. This is now my go-to rack.
review.name: Solid Rack

review.reviewBody: This is a great, well made rack.  The one improvement I would suggest is to have the positioning of the wheel chock on the tray adjustable, to accommodate different bike sizes, so every bike can be centered on the tray.
review.name: Great rack

review.reviewBody: It is very nice but I do have to say that I have all 4 bike trays and with all of them together it is very heavy to install and carry back and forth to my truck and off again. I think for the people who bought all 4 you should also give them the RACK DOLLIE!! Just saying!!! 😉👍🏼
review.name: MHS DUO

review.reviewBody: This was perfect for our MHS 2 we have, and it saved our trip! I wanted to bring 3 bikes on our latest bike trip and was planning for one inside our Outback, turns out we had more stuff than anticipated so that wasn't happening. This add on made our bike trip all that we wanted it to be, and after the 11hr drive it was still just as solid as when we left.
review.name: Just what we needed

name: MHS Duo 1-Bike Add-On

review.reviewBody: Everything I was looking for- sleek beautiful design, lightweight, comfortable straps, spacious, just the right number and configuration of pockets and zippered compartments, and a luggage sleeve so I can put it on top of my roller luggage. I had been looking for years for something like this. I hope you start to advertise it more so people can discover your product because this is travel backpack perfected.
review.name: Perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used this backpack twice for a trip. The backpack looks pretty cool and sleek. I was a little apprehensive because when empty, the backpack has a hard time standing up on its own but after I put my items in it, it held up pretty well. It cleans pretty easily on the outside and has enough space to fit my laptop and all my travel carryon items. Will continue to use this and recommend.
review.name: Good backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ready for some hiking or International traveling?  This Thule backpack has it all with the storage compartments inside. Now you can bring both your computer and tablet with peace of mind they will be protected within. You could even bring two water bottles for a hike and stay well hydrated. Sorry the kitchen sink will not fit inside but you will be surprised at all that can fit. The material is sturdy and rich feeling for texture. The price may seem steep but for how well it is made and the usefulness I would recommend it for all you adventure enthusiasts!
review.name: Thule Heavy Duty Backpack with Style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a versatile bag with ample storage capacity. It seems very durable, but I do wish it had a reinforced bottom to stand up on its own. Comfortable straps make it easy to carry to and from work.
review.name: Durable bag with plenty of storage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love this tote! Perfect to take on trip - it has so many pockets (for electronics, other items, passport/ID). It’s also a great bag to take to the gym and pack your work stuff! Super comfortable, easy to use. Oh and it also has a trolley sleeve which is perfect for trips
review.name: Versatile, multi purpose durable tote

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect and very large , i love how the model looks, perfect for travel, and also very comfortable. A lot of space in it. Thanks for the great design and product
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is the perfect airport bag! It feels incredibly sturdy, it fits a ton of stuff, and I love the little external pocket for your quick-grab items like your phone, wallet, earbuds, etc. The little external pocket actually has a zipper on the outside, of course, but it also has an internal zipper as well! So you can get to your small items quickly and conveniently either way. The fabric is also a fantastic choice for this type of bag. It’s not too precious for long-term, heavy-duty use, and it even seems somewhat water repellant. I generally trust Thule products and I would definitely buy this again!
review.name: Love it! The perfect airport bag.

name: Subterra Tote

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned most helmet brands and this one not only fits well and offers good coverage, it’s also very lightweight (285g) and it is barely-there comfortable.  The ventilation is on par with my POC Octal TdF Edition (260g) but since the Octal forehead pad is disintegrating and I couldn’t find replacements, I got this helmet to replace it.  I always add reflectivity stickers to my helmets for conspicuity during low-ambient-light riding (morning/evening commutes/training).  Longevity is yet to be seen for this great piece of kit.
review.name: Safety, breathability, beauty + bling.

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is everything I could have wanted. First, it is lightweight... like really lightweight! So much so it feels like I am not wearing anything which is amazing (and the point!). 

Second, the fit. I love it. The chin straps are adjustable but I can see if you have long ears it may be annoying where the straps hit, however for me it is PERFECT. 

and Third, very very ventilated. The hot summers have nothing on this helmet, so great to have the safety and protection of POC while not compromising airflow. Recommend!
review.name: So light!

review.reviewBody: straps are not adjustable and sewn together, does not work at all
review.name: non adjustable straps

name: Ventral Lite Helmet

review.reviewBody: I have a 30in waist, all the pants I own are size 30. That is right in the middle of their recommendation for "small". This isn't even close to fitting, consider sizing up or even twice
review.name: Sizing is way off

review.reviewBody: Other reviews have said to size up...this is not my experience. I normally would have gone with a medium (32" waist) but decided on large based on the other reviews. I cannot get this harness tight enough on me even with thick clothing on.
review.name: Don't size up

review.reviewBody:
This is a great ultralight harness & super versatile and comfortable (for what it is).  Excellent functionality and some of the best racking on this type of harness.  Super light and compact too.  I prefer this to the Petzl Fly.  

That said - the sizing is off.  I'm a 32" waist and based on Mammut's sizing chart I should be a comfortable medium.   In reality I barley squeeze into the medium's hip belt.  I have thick legs and the legs are fine though.  

Overall, I'd highly recommend this harness, with the caviot that folks should try it on in-store.  Hopeful that Mammut can address the sizing issue, but likely plan to size up on this harness.  

Would be 5 stars, but for the sizing issue.
review.name: Great harness - mixed sizing

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight harness great for ski traverses. The sizing is a bit smaller than expected.

name: Eiger Speed Harness

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Haldigrat HS Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This material is too thin for anything but the most strenuous skinning in somewhat warm weather. I live in a ski town and skied about 35 days this year and even in warmer conditions this material just does not block wind. I would not recommend for anything except backcountry use. On a hut trip these are good light and have well thought out storage and pocket for transceiver.
review.name: Just not resistant enough

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for resort skiing and touring. The fit is excellent and temperature control is solid with generous zipper vents on the sides. 

I've skied in thigh deep powder without any snow intrusion. Fits well over a ski boot. Wouldn't climb in them since the bottom is baggier and I'd catch a crampon. 

Noticed they're not as waterproof as other pants I've owned. I'm unconcerned for my needs, but figured worth a callout to those with that consideration.
review.name: Excellent ski pant

review.reviewBody: Mammut puts a ton of thought into their designs. This bibs are incredibly comfortable but also have some fundamental features for backcountry travel. The torso and right thigh pockets both have integrated lanyards for attaching your beacon. Mammut pants do fit a bit tight though so order a size up. I'm 6'4", 230 lbs. I normally wear 35x34 pants but ordered the size 38 bibs so I'd have room for mid layer pants underneath. I've worn them with and without midlayer pants and they fit great either way
review.name: Top tier bibs

review.reviewBody: I'm going to buy another of these as backup.  They're the perfect bib for skinning and resort days.

Love these pants, the only feedback is that the top section is not water proof but water resistant.  Honestly probably fine, and helps with comfort of the pants, but partially defeates the purpose of a bib.  

Its design is to be snug.  Again makes it comfortable but will compress a down mid layer if worn underneath
review.name: Comfortable, light and trim

review.reviewBody: I love the weight and material of the pants.  I found they performed well.  Nice fit a d feature set.  The elastic cuffs however failed within a few uses and there is no way to cinch it down.  Will probably have to add a snap.  Not sure what material they used in the elastic or if my pair was defective but it's horrible.
review.name: Almost a perfect hardshell bib

review.reviewBody: I've used these bibs now for about 20 days both in the backcountry and at the resort. They work great for any situation. They have the mobility to make kick turns while skinning or take high steps while boot packing and have enough room to layer underneath when it is cold. The vents are large and allow a good amount of air in while working hard. Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for non-insulated bibs.
review.name: Perfect bibs for backcountry or resort

review.reviewBody: 6'5" 195 lbs. I have long arms, long legs and fairly broad shoulders and a slim waist. I got these in a 36L and I was worried that they would be much too baggy around the waist but it fits a lot slimmer than I thought. There is just enough room for a jacket or hoodie underneath the bibs without being tight. The length is great for me. Features are awesome so far, very light and comfortable.
review.name: Very glad I bought oversized

review.reviewBody:
These are lightweight, ski bib shell pants. They are quite slim fitting, so consider your size when you purchase. They are one of the few pants on the market which have small and tall sizes. I am 193cm and 84kg, and the 32long (48long Europe) fits me well. The pants are regular fit, which looks great for skiing, and provides great flexiblity to move. 
The bib is a close-fitting warmer (but not waterproof layer). As it is tight fitting, I can get a base and thin-mid layer under it. But if you run very cold, you would not be able to get a thicker heavy-mid layer under unless you sized up. 
The Mammut Dry Technology has a very high waterproof rating, and is worth considering over other waterproofing technologies such as goretex.
There are two thigh pockets and a chest pocket for a beacon. I cannot fit my phone in the chest pocket (Google Pixel), but would usually store it in my jacket. Consider whether this is important to you. 
The kick plates around the hem, are not the thickest material I have seen, but are easily able to cope with the edges of your skis. The denier of the fabric is lower than others out there. This helps to achieve a lower weight, but does not have te same "bomb-proof" feeling of 70D / 80D. 
If you are looking for modern-styled, do it all shell bib-pants that come in a range of sizes, it is hard to find anything better at this price point.
review.name: Great Shell Bib-Pants - for all sizes

name: Haldigrat HS Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have a Lumina 650 for commuting and it has been great. Bought the Lumina 1000 for trial riding and it does not take a charge. Working with Nightrider to get a replacement shipped. Wish someone had checked it out before shipping faulty product. (exercising the warranty appears to be going very smoothly so for that I am grateful.
review.name: Poor quality control

review.reviewBody: I had this light for over a year, maybe 2. It got lots of use. It was great. Eventually it stopped charging and it no longer works at all. I expected it to last longer.
review.name: Eventually stopped charging

review.reviewBody: Good light, but plastic mount is too weak.  Don't recommend if you ride aggressively.
review.name: Mount broke after a few rides.

hasVariant.name: Ghost 2.5L Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 686 Ghost 2.5L Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For those looking for lightweight pants, this is a solid choice. Really like that the knee and butt panels are slightly more rugged to be durable, so you’re not trading durability for weight. Roomy pockets to fit everything I need - spare lens, phone, protein bars.
review.name: Lightweight and cool

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size, durable and rad collab with huf
review.name: One of the best collabs I’ve seen

review.reviewBody: Awesome set! Love how they fit. Finally a throw back to the baggy 90’s fit. Material is nice and seems durable. They are just a shell so definitely need to layer up underneath for warmth.
review.name: 686 Ghost pants and jacket

review.reviewBody: Pants fit true to size and the included belt does a great job of keeping the waistband where you need it. Has plenty of room in the seat and knees for all conditions of riding. The stiching and quality is all there and the cordoroy gives you the classic look with steez 🤘🏽
review.name: Ghost 2.5L pants

review.reviewBody: Looks amazing and has a great ajustable waist band with a belt to secure it. My one critique is that I wish this came in as an insulated version and wasnt just a shell pant.
review.name: Swag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I order the pants because I love the baggy look . But being 5'6" with a 36 waist I orders XL thinking it'll be comfortable and be the right baggy but was way to big . The kne pads are at my ankles. I want to send them back and get a large but it will cost me just to do that. Do I have no choice but to keep them and not wear them ?
review.name: Too big for my hight and waist size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good pants, i love how they added zipper pockets.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving these shell pants for beater days in the woods or park. Taking abuse like champions since day 1!
review.name: Durable Shell

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At 5.7ft and 150lb, the M size seems a bit large. Typically, this type of ski/snb pants is designed for those who need to wear inner pants.
review.name: Good stuff

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I feel like they're nice but for the ventilation system I think it needs a mesh layer for snow to not go inside of the pant.
review.name: I feel like they're nice

name: Ghost 2.5L Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Perform Down Sleeping Bag: 19F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Perform Down Sleeping Bag: 19F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Perform Down Sleeping Bag: 19F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: One week in the Grand Canyon from 30-50 at night and slept great.  Rained last 3 days but bag outperformed and a little damp kept me warm.  Great value at discounted price.  Center zipper a bit getting used to but worked well. No sleeping on your side with a zipper underneath you.

This bag is extremely comfortable, it condenses down to a very small size, and clearly uses high quality material.  Has been nothing short of amazing on cold nights in the mountains.  Love the middle zip, too.
review.name: Zero Complaints

review.reviewBody: So warm and compacts to a small size for backcountry adventures!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable bag I have tried in this temperature range. The zipper is fabulous and doesn't snag, the inside is soft and I felt really warm sleeping with nothing but underwear at -1 Celsius. It packs small and the earplugs and mask are a small bonus
review.name: Warm & Comfy

review.reviewBody: I did a week of camping around the southern Okanagan on a rock climbing trip and slept in the bag each night. Slept like a king every night. The eye mask blacks it out and there are a set of ear deci damps. The sleeping bag is super comfortable, highly functional zippers that don't catch on the fabric. I could go on and on but this sleeping bag did not disappoint on any level.
review.name: Best sleeping system I have ever used.

review.reviewBody: This sleeping bag packs very small, perfect for backpacking. It's very comfortable and keeps me very warm
review.name: Lightweight and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Good fit for me, 5'11" and 172 lbs. I like the ear plugs and eye shade that come with it. Warm enough for early spring camping.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Good quality bag. I tend to sleep with my arm under my head, so the tightness of the hood isn't ideal. Otherwise it's plenty warm, the zipper is snagless, and it packs pretty tight.

I haven't had a chance to take it on any excursions but have used it for car/ tent camping and have woken up sweating on multiple occasions. The down packs very well and doesn't stay bunched when unpacked. Zipper doesn't snag and the complimentary sleep mask is a nice touch for people who struggle with light sensitivity.
review.name: Lightweight, Compactable, Super Warm

review.reviewBody:
Very confortable and soft. It is also quiet, I move a lot so it's good for my girlfriend too.
The best part is the central zip with the anti-snag, you can't go back to side zip after trying it.
Overall it seem tough, I sleep 1 month in it.
Con: it's not the most compressible sleepingbag

name: Perform Down Sleeping Bag: 19F Down

description: Buy the Mammut Taiss SO Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Taiss SO Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Taiss SO Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Taiss SO Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Taiss SO Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been searching for the perfect soft shell pants and finally found them!  These pants are so comfortable and fit like a glove.  I love the adjustable waist and how they offer different inseam lengths.  Yay long!  I’m looking forward to wearing these skate skiing this winter with a light base layer underneath.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great pants and very light weight. Breathe great but cut the wind slightly. The cuffs are not bc ski boot compatible. A zipper on the pant cuff would be great to get them to fit over various boots. They fit well with hiking shoes/boots, cross-country ski boots, and skimo race boots. Personally, I found the fit kind of snug. I am 5' 6" and 120 lbs, and usually wear a 4. I bought these in size 4 but would prefer a 6. I can see these being really good for winter hiking/climbing with a layer underneath. By themselves they are definitely not warm, but they are meant more for hiking I think.  Edit: after a wet fatbike ride the fabric in bum area has worn to a lighter shade of blue. I only got 4-6 uses out of these pants.
review.name: Nice pants, lightweight

review.reviewBody: I would definitely size up, I am usually a size 2 and was a size 6 in these pants. They fit great, love the adjustable waistband. They move well and hold up with glissading!
Pants fit great, are very comfortable and materials feel high quality. too soon to rate durability. So far very happy with the purchase!
review.name: Great fit! Stylish and versatile

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable fabric that moves with you and durable enough to have stood up to rocky hikes in the Andes and the alps. The zip pocket on the thigh comes in handy for everything from ID to an iPhone (+ size).

Great pants and very light weight. Breathe great but cut the wind slightly. The cuffs are not bc ski boot compatible. A zipper on the pant cuff would be great to get them to fit over various boots. They fit well with hiking shoes/boots, cross-country ski boots, and skimo race boots. Personally, I found the fit kind of snug. I am 5' 6" and 120 lbs, and usually wear a 4. I bought these in size 4 but would prefer a 6. I can see these being really good for winter hiking/climbing with a layer underneath. By themselves they are definitely not warm, but they are meant more for hiking I think.
review.name: Nice pants, lightweight

review.reviewBody: These pants are good for just about anything.  I wear them for work as a Server and also for climbing and any hike.  The fit is perfect ( I'm 5'2 125lbs wearing a size 34). To summarize: Sleek, durable, comfortable.
review.name: multifunctional

review.reviewBody: I bought these for hiking and mountain climbing.   I live in Northern MN and have worn them in 45-70 degree temps. The stretch of the fabric is comfortable.  After wearing out camping/hiking over three days, they held their fit...they didn't get too loose like some hiking pants do. The color is rad.  I like them so much I just bought a second pair in black.  Depending upon how you like your pants to fit, I ordered a size 44 which had a bit more room than the size 42.  The 42 fits more snug of course.  I typically buy 44 if I might do a thin base layer underneath.  42 is great if not planning on ever wearing anything underneath. Ps. I'm not a petite and can't thank Mammut enough for making awesome, quality, stylish outdoor wear for people that are a variety of shapes and sizes.  You are my go to brand!
review.name: Exceptional quality

name: Taiss SO Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Nite Ize Steelie Orbiter Plus Dash Kit online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Steelie Orbiter Plus Dash Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize Steelie Orbiter Plus Dash Kit online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using these for many years, because they work, without being complicated or taking up a lot of space. Very simple, clean, functional design.
review.name: Nice, functional, durable.

review.reviewBody: I bought the new one thinking it going to be a better then the old one I put the ring on my phone case left it for a 24hours to hold before I tested it out at frist the magnet part never stuck properly kept falling off and would never stay on the one day the ring fell off completely and it's just not worth buying the new one I'd stick to the regular
review.name: Dose not work comes off
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear that this product didn't work out for you. I will say that metal ring is not supposed to go on your case but on the wireless charger. The magnet should stick right to your MagSafe compatible case or to the back of your MagSafe compatible phone. We are always happy to help troubleshoot if you reach out to us via email at info@niteize.com or our wfg form under the contact us section on our website.

review.reviewBody: Nice hold for my iPhone but as soon as I attach my MagSafe charger to the magnet it stops charging my phone.
review.name: Nice hold but having an issue
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about the issue with the charging while using the Orbiter attached. We have a lot of different troubleshooting options so just reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we will do everything we can to help!

review.reviewBody: Mounting the ball on my dash required me to add a second layer of 3M automotive tape to address the slight gap where I wanted the mount with my phone attached. This is not a mount problem but where it was located could have used a more flexible surface. Otherwise it works perfectly!
review.name: Ball mount

review.reviewBody: The regular orbiter is better than the plus. The magnet isn’t as strong and my phone sags.
review.name: Does the job, but not as well as the original.
comment: Hi Jasmine, we are sorry to hear about the trouble you have had with your phone sagging with the new Steelie Orbiter Plus for MagSafe. We would be happy to troubleshoot and see if there is anything we can do to help it not sag as much. Just reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we can talk through some solutions for you.

review.reviewBody: very practical device for holding my cell phone in a convenient spot in my car.
review.name: Cell phone holder

review.reviewBody: We learned about this dash kit for phones when we were on a bike trip. We love using it as it's a safe place for the phone and the phone can be easily seen while driving.
review.name: Steelie Dash Kit

review.reviewBody: This is the cleanest, strongest magnetic mount i've found. The included ring makes it work with non magnetic phones and cases, it stays out of the way and holds your phone safe in view for navigation or charging. This last version is the most minimalist i've owned without having to add anything to my phone to click in place. 360 rotation in all directions makes it great when using the phone screen for nav or co-nav screens.
review.name: Minimalist and strongest in class!

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and holds iPhone 14 securely. It does require moving the phone around a bit to find the magnetic “sweet spot”.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: I've had the holder in my car for over a year and i continue to love it. The piece on my phone is low profile so it doesn't get stuck in my holster. The magnet is super strong and keeps my phone on the ball no matter how rough the ride is. I have a galaxy z fold 3, so the phone has a little weight to it. Again i love it
review.name: Love it!

name: Steelie Orbiter Plus Dash Kit

description: Buy the POC Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The velcro strap on the left glove was already hanging on 2 threads when I got the gloves, so I returned them. The fit wasn't great for my relatively thin hands with long fingers. Expensive. They do have a nice combo of protection and being lightweight.
review.name: Velcro loose on arrival

review.reviewBody:
Just came in the mail to replace my worn out trusty kitsbow gloves. They are not touch screen compatible. I have an iPhone in one and this glove on my other hand and am tapping - nothing is working on the phone response to it. 

The fit is a big on the tighter side of medium.
review.name: Not actually touch screen compatible

review.reviewBody: I'm an overconfident novice mountain biker and bought these because when I land on my palms, my half gloves let my fingertips touch the ground, and I was looking for protection from that.  (also because they look cooler).  I was disappointed that the pads on the palms are thin and don't fully pad the bottom of your hand.  I'm able to use my thumb on my iPhone but not the fingers -- just enough to press "record"  on Strava.  Update:  I have used them 20+ times and they are holding up fine (I hand wash and air dry them).  Also I just cut the velcro strap off because the glove is not going to come off on it's own so you don't need it.  Upgrading to 4 stars.
review.name: weak palm padding but otherwise great

review.reviewBody:
Comftable while having good protection.
Shows early sign of strap coming loose.
review.name: Good fit!

review.reviewBody: It?s flexible, ergonomic, air ventilation and breathability is great, paddings are ok but velcro doesn?t work well and the most importantly, the fabric started falling apart from the wrist area due to get on and off. i would expect more durable fabric but it?s definitely not. after eight weeks daily bases usage, it would not have been like this. I don?t recommend this glove; I?ll probably try other brands next time
review.name: Velcro, stain and low-quality fabric

review.reviewBody: The POC VDP works to protect your hand from when you misjudge the space between two trees!  Its the same material they use on other armor products POC sells. Although the picture makes them look burly and heavy, they are comfortable and breath well. They allow a solid handlebar feel.   I went up one size from the guide, the glove comes off just a little easier but still fit snugly.  My hand measures just below the cut-off between the large and XL.  So, technically, they are true to size. One disappointment is that the gloves fingers won't work on an iPhone X but that's not really why you buy a glove like this.  Again, buy this glove for the protection, comfort and grip feel.     A note about the velcro, honestly, I dont see why you even need a closure on this glove,  they are cut in a way that the closure doesn't add anything.
review.name: comfortable and protective

review.reviewBody: The gloves breath very well for the Texas summer heat, excellent protection and touches in the right places. Would have given 5 stars if the velcro straps actually  held. Only complaint.
review.name: Great gloves, almost

review.reviewBody:
After three rides the velcro no longer sticks and the strap just floats in the air. I've had to modify the glove to add my own velcro. The gloves appear solidly built and they breathe well in the heat.

I would not recommend.
review.name: good gloves, velcro quality is wanting

name: Resistance Pro DH Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ultralight Gore Tex shell perfect for hiking and biking.  Superior quality to the PacLite Gore Tex shells, this offers more peace of mind with better waterproof and great breathability.  Well worth paying a bit more to ensure dry gear while in a Rocky Mountain downpour.
review.name: Super light Gore Tex

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't used it, but it fits very well. My height is 181, chest 89. I took the average size. Sat very well. You can wear a sweater.
review.name: I haven't used it, but it fits very well.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome! Lightweight, comfortable...not a typical plastic-ey crinkly jacket from other companies. Haven't had any rain to wear it in yet, (Arizona, need I say more?🤣) but I'm sure it will be awesome, based on the great way it's made!
review.name: Awesome jacket, great buy!!!

review.reviewBody:
Got this in a size up, to layer over warmer clothes for winter travel to cold/wet climates. It is waterproof and that's a big plus in driving rain and wind. I don't love the army green color but the alternates were not available in the size I wanted.

 I took off a star for these issues. First, the hood (while adjustable with the back pull) is not great in wind. It is a bit oversized to fit over a heavy hat (or helmet) and wants to blow off. With just my Merino beanie, it leaves a lot of fabric behind my head. Second, the cargo pockets work but I wish there were waist level pockets. Hard to get a phone or wallet out of the pockets as designed. Third (minor) the hem adjustment would ideally work on both sides. It can be pulled tighter but bunches up more on the right side.

Otherwise, a great jacket especially at the sale price. The pit zips are perfect. The velcro cuffs have a wide adjustment range. The 2-way zipper is useful. And rain tested - no leaks.
review.name: Great coat esp on sale

review.reviewBody: Great jacket.  The sleeves are a bit too long.  Otherwise very nice!
review.name: Great jacket with long sleeves.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this rainproof jacket with pit zips. It's functional and flattering. Mostly I loved the  deep green, "Nori" color.
review.name: Great, simple, functional,  jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what I need for my travel!  It will keep me dry and warm.
review.name: Excellent product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wife likes it. Sleeves are longer than normal - which she appreciates. Nice lightweight, waterproof shell.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have tried a few Marmot rain jackets, this is by far the best fitting if you prefer a less boxy fit.  I got the jacket in nori, it’s a beautiful green, not too bright or dull.  The sleeves may be on the longer side if you are petite.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is of excellent quality. If you want to keep water out and are going to be in cooler temps I highly recommend it. I am using year-round for cost saving with layers or not. If I had the means I would use this only for colder temperatures which I think is what it was designed for.
review.name: Best for chilly or cold wet weather

name: Mitre Peak Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Purchased these as a gift after a lot of research. The sole separated from the shoe after just a few uses. I emailed support for assistance and never heard back. I recommend purchasing different shoes from a different company.
review.name: Sole seperating from shoe

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this shoe. I purchased them specifically for the rock gym. Great grip and extremely comfortable.

I've been climbing for 2 years, and I need new warm up shoes.  These are solid shoes for anyone that want a quick warm up on a 5.9 or below or a good shoe for a new climber.  The size fits slightly snug based on your shoe size, but feels fine on the wall.

name: Defy Lace Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the The North Face Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had an older pair that lasted four years, these are a little taller but the same basic fit. Really nice if you have high arches, there’s nice support inside them
review.name: Good for bad weather

review.reviewBody: Purchased these last month, they fit great, easy to walk in. One thing I noticed was the tongue did not fold well and created a hard surface on my shin with walking. I am still breaking in the fold to stay flat
review.name: Easy on and off, nice height

review.reviewBody: These seem great, but based on the reviews, I went up a full size, and they were way too big, even with thick socks.  I'd recommend going up only a half size.
review.name: Size up but not a full size

review.reviewBody:
These are the best boots ever! I live in northern California. It doesn't snow here. However, the rainy season is pretty cold for my comfort. Regular rain boots keep my feet dry and freezing. Not fun when you need to run errands. These boots save the day. Not only are my feet dry but most importantly, they are nice and warm. 
After reading the reviews, I decided to buy one size up from my usual 8. They were way too big. Returned them for a size 8.5. Perfect fit. So, be cautious on the sizing. For some, sizing up a full size worked great. However, that wasn't the case for me. 
These boots are warm, comfortable, and stylish. Most definitely recommend them.
review.name: comfortable and warm but runs small

review.reviewBody: I really like these but definitely size up! I want to wear thick socks because I live in MI. I didn’t read the reviews until I bought them and they are right. I got a 7 and needed an 8. Just bought another pair and am returning the 7’s
review.name: Love them butttt

review.reviewBody:
I wore my North Face Shellista boots for years until I somehow put a crack in the sole. Just had to buy this newer version and based on reviews, bought a full size larger. The new boot is the same dimensions as my previous boot and fits great. 
This has been my all-season go to boot for all-terrain casual walks, long day hikes, farm work. Comfortable, good support, long lasting.
review.name: Best women's boot for all seasons

review.reviewBody: These boots are great! The feel good and look good.   I'm disappointed in the sizing.  They run a whole size small.  I am a true 9 and I got a 9.5.  They fit fine with normal socks, but in the winter I wear winter socks (nothing crazy, but thicker than typical)  and they don't fit in the boot.  I'm going to keep them because they don't have a 10 and I like them that much.   Hopefully they are warm enough I don't need to wear thicker socks.  I live in MN. Can get pretty cold.
review.name: Great boots runs small

review.reviewBody: I don?t know if these boots changed since all of the positive reviews, but I bought them based on the reviews and promptly returned both pairs. I bought two sizes because I listened to the sizing advice and went up a size - those were MASSIVE and I felt like a duck and they buckle out and give you undeniable cankles the size of swollen golf balls on both sides of your ankles. I bought my normal size and  they fit fine with heavy socks. With cankles. Normal golf ball size cankles. No thank you. They generally weren?t that comfortable either - a lot of weird extra space in the foot and I have high insteps so that?s rarely a problem. The treading didn?t seem that great either. I went with the Helly Hansen Garibaldi VIs instead and they are soooo much better for me - so warm, comfortable, did great on trails, I love them.
review.name: Cankles

review.reviewBody: After reading several reviews for these across the 'net, I decided The North Face Shellista II Mid Boot was the boot for me in terms of waterproofing, durability, grip, comfort, and warmth. Several reviews, however, mention that the sizing runs SMALL. This is TRUE! And I say this as someone who struggles to find a women's size 5 shoe that isn't too big for me (I wish there was a size 4.75, because 4.5 is too small!). I am a grown adult woman, but my feet are baby feet, tiny and narrow. I took a gamble and ordered the size 6 based on the reviews (and the fact that it's the smallest size available anywhere!) and they fit PERFECTLY with thick wool socks. In fact, my big toes are about 1/2 - 3/4 inch from hitting the front walls. For comparison, my size 5 Adidas sneakers are almost the same size as these. They feel great after a test drive walking around my neighborhood. I am yet to test drive them in the snow, but I'll say that my feet were running HOT walking 20 minutes in Southern California 55 degree winter temps. Looking forward to putting them to the real test in snowy New England in a few weeks! I feel confident they'll be great!
review.name: Excellent, but heed sizing advice

review.reviewBody: To say I loved these boots is an understatement. AFter reading through some reviews I decided to go up a size to a 7 (usually I'm between a 6 and a 6.5). They fit perfectly and even had room for a thicker sock. I used them hiking in upstate NY in the snow and my feet never got cold! (with microspikes on the bottoms) Super comfortable and barely had to break them in! I couldn't be happier with my purchase! would absolutely buy again!
review.name: LOOOOOOOVVEEEEEE

name: Shellista II Mid Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I recently got this helmet and so far it's been great. One big complaint I have is that while it says it's compatible with the Aleck audio systems, once I put the chips into the liner and remove the foam, it's way too tight and my ears get pressed into my head in a uncomfortable way. I was looking forward to using this with my Ski Patrol radio in that aspect, but alas. Still a great helmet and a beautiful color.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: The fit is very comfortable. The integration with SMITH goggles is perfect and adds to the comfortable fit. As for protection, well I haven’t tested it but trust SMITH with my safety on snow, single track and road!
review.name: The fit is very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I have finally found the perfect helmet! You can remove the liner inside which is a frequent question for this type of helmet. It is a very light helmet and looks swaggy as well.
review.name: My favorite helmet so far

review.reviewBody: Helmet was too small and Backcountry will not provide me a refund back onto my card because of the box that I shipped this product in which was the exact same box I received it in. DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS WEBSITE
review.name: Too Small, NO REFUNDS

review.reviewBody: The helmet is very solid. Everything you'd expect from a good winter helmet. However, with the way the ear pads are designed, it is really uncomfortable with the aleck wireless helmet speakers to the point I don't use them at all. A bit disappointing since the product itself is good, just don't think the adequate space was given to fully claim "comfortable compatibility "
review.name: Great helmet, so so Aleck chips integration

review.reviewBody: Works beautifully with my Mag goggles. Hiked in the backcountry at 12k+ altitude without ever taking off my goggles and NEVER fogged up. I strongly believe it was because of the helmet/goggle integration. Highly recommend.
review.name: Works beautifully with my Mag goggles

review.reviewBody: Super annoying. It runs really small and  you need to pay for the return!
review.name: Runs really small

review.reviewBody: Fits great, super comfortable and tight integration with goggles.
review.name: Fits great, super comfortable and

review.reviewBody: I went 35 years without wearing a helmet consistently, they were always too bulky and heavy. I'm old and ready to wear a helmet and the code was so light that I didn't even know I was wearing it. The sizing is a little smaller than the Smith MTB helmets with the padding and ear flaps. Once I took those out I would say the sizing is spot on with my other Smith MTB helmets. If I'm going to wear a helmet, this one looks pretty cool too.
review.name: I went 35 years without

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits really well and is easy to wear on the mountain all day!
review.name: Great Product

name: Code Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Look at the model picture, just like the picture my knees are way above the patches even when I kneel rendering them useless. Small short has always fit me from tnf and these have a strange fit. Otherwise they are nice with good features like full side zips and warm.
review.name: Dees knees aren't in dees shins

review.reviewBody: Full side zips and front zip make these practical and easy to use. I am athletic 5' 10" 155 lbs and Medium is perfectly sized top layer over Medium base layer and Medium shell pants. Wished that they included crampon kick patches. Use these for snow camps, cold belays, and summit days.
review.name: Excellent Down Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had an issue with a sleeping bag after washing it cause if stuffing to move quite a lot
review.name: Warranty exchange

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 30% off after I buy it. 
And everything we have purchased has failed or ripped in two outings 
No more seatotrash for our family.
review.name: Failed gear and constantly getting frustrated

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like the compressibility and weight of this bag. Just what I need for the fall and spring in my area. My only complaint is that the zipper is on the left, which I can't get used to. The door of my Alto TR1 is on the right (as well as most other single door tents) and so is the storage pocket. I am used to being able to unzip the bag a bit and access the door of my tent and the pocket for my phone ect. I can still get to these things but I would prefer the zipper on the right like all my other sleeping bags.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is well made and very functional. Zippers work well and are easy to use. And of course, it's very light, which is the primary reason I got it. 

I'd definitely buy again.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is definitely incredible. 
Its packability is superb and it’s lightweight. 
It’s very comfortable in temps well below its 45f rating (32F) with the addition of just a pair of good down booties and a down jacket. 
Ive used it for fastpacking in the high peaks of Colorado with a bivy.
review.name: Heavenly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag! great for ultra light mountain travel.
review.name: Love this bag! great for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This weighs nothing at all. It's so amazing. I feel lucky to have this. It's crazy warm and soft and cozy. If I could sleep in it every night I would. I'm amazed by how warm this is with it weighing nothing at all.
review.name: Absolutely incredible

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a super comfortable, durable, and warm sleeping bag. I was impressed since it is super lightweight and easy to carry, especially with the bag it comes in. I do wish it was more compact, depise it being super lightweight, I feel like it takes up a lot of space.
review.name: Super Light Yet Warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so impressed how light this sleeping bag is, but still keeps me warm! Compresses down without a problem - perfect companion for a backpacker/hiker.  Love the attention to detail with the zipper - did not have any issues with snagging.  Camped on a lake island with temps getting in the low 40s and still was comfortably warm.  Material is easy to clean and shake out.  10/10 recommend.
review.name: Light & small, but performs great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is spacious and I love that it has a long zipper that make it easy to get in and out. It’s light weight and keep me warm in the cold weather.
review.name: Good sleeping bag

name: Spark Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

review.reviewBody: This is the most comfee backpacking shirt I now own. Feels so soft against my skin, quick dry, moisture wicking, oder control and cools me down on those elevation climbs. I love it. 5'6" 120lbs. Size small fit perfect.
review.name: Awesome shirt!

review.name: Looks great

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas at his request for his mountain biking.  He loves it!! I'm sure I will be buying more for him as he has a birthday in February...
review.name: Perfect for my grandson

review.reviewBody:
Great jersey, allows lots of movement, plenty of space for pads, super breathable.

Glad I have some experience with TLD products running small. I am usually between a men's L and LX but had to order the XXL. besides the jersey running a bit small, I love it. 

Crash Resistant!  had a decent crash the other day that left my left arm pretty banged up, however, this durable jersey likely prevented worse
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.reviewBody: Wow, this jersey is great! It's so breathable. I'm a female size medium and bought a men's small and the fit is amazing. I swear it fits better than a women's jersey would!
review.name: Breathable, great fit for females!
